Vacant RTE seats: Second roundadmissions.description: NAGPUR: Parents whose wards have been selected for school admissions under RTE quota in the second round have time till June 27 to complete the admission formalities. With almost 50% RTE seats in Nagpur district remaining vacant, authorities are hoping that all selected parents complete the admission process so that the gap can be bridged further. Out of the total 7,204 RTE seats in the district, only 3,714 could be filled. In the second round, 2,731 students have been offered seats for which the admission deadline is June 27. However, it is almost guaranteed that RTE seats will remain vacant in many schools as majority of the parents try for branded English medium schools. In fact, in Nagpur the applications received were more than 300% of the seats available. But many applications get rejected because of improper address being mentioned or documents not being in order. There have been many cases of parents ‘shifting’ their residence close to a well known school so that they become eligible for RTE under the distance criteria. In RTE, preference is given to students who reside closest to the school. But many issues related to mapping of address in the online application form also created multiple issues. NGO RTE Action Committee had filed official objections over the address mapping in the online software as many admissions had been rejected because of this. Following these issues, the education department formed a verification committee which comprised of its own officials plus other experts. This committee then scrutinizes applications that have been rejected and ensures that it has been done so only due to valid reasons. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

NMC reduces power bill by 52% after LED.description: NAGPUR: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation’s (NMC) LED street lights project has started to yield good results. Power consumption has reduced by 52.41% even though the project is yet to be completed. NMC said 1.28 lakh of total 1.43 lakh street lights have been converted from sodium vapour to LED. The civic body is planning to finish the work on remaining 15,000 street lights within a month. An NMC official told TOI the power bill for street lights has come down to Rs2.28 crore per month (Rs27.36 crore per annum) from earlier billing of Rs4.35 crore per month (Rs52.20 crore per annum). This is a saving of Rs2.07 crore per month (Rs24.84 crore per annum). “The power bill will further reduce once the entire project is completed,” he said. NMC has replaced 60 watt sodium vapour bulb with 36 watt LEDs on internal roads, and 60 watt, 105 watt and 120 watt sodium vapour lamps on major roads, squares and playgrounds with 285 watt LEDs. Apart from saving power by conversion into LED, NMC has installed a system where street lights are dimmed by 40% by 10pm and 50% by midnight. This is done automatically. NMC officials added the automatic switch-on and switch-off system will further reduce power consumption of street lights. “Under the same project, we will install a system to automatically start street lights after sunset and switch-off by sunrise. Also, timings will be set properly in the system,” he said. For decades, street lights have been seen burning well before sunset, especially during summer days, wasting power. The total cost of the LED project is Rs470 crore of which Rs277 crore is for installing LED systems. Also, NMC aims to ensure majority street lights are included in the project. NMC is spending Rs59 crore on infrastructure development, where old power cables and street light poles will be replaced. Also, NMC is spending Rs28 crore for new street light infrastructure on under-construction Inner Ring Road and Metro rail corridors. NMC is executing all these works through eight private companies. It is mandatory for the companies to operate and maintain the street lights for 99 months, for which they will be paid Rs106 crore. With all these works, NMC is confident of proper functioning of street lights. An NMC official said the project will lead to a profit for the civic body. “NMC will get LED street lights, new infrastructure and systems without spending anything. Entire cost of the project will be recovered from savings in power bills and high cost of current annual maintenance,” he said. However, the project has been delayed to some extent due to delays in getting permission from the state government for seeking loans, ongoing works on Inner Ring Road Cement Concrete project, flyovers and Metro Rail. The works to install LED street lights was supposed to be completed by August 2018. NMC has also issued work orders to private companies for operating all these street lights on solar. Expense on power bill will go down further while also benefiting the environment. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nJohn Abraham, Varun Dhawan and Jacquel.description: When a fan challenged Varun Dhawan to lift his 'Dishoom' co-star John Abraham, he sportingly did so at a college event in Nagpur. Later, at a media event in Nagpur, Varun Dhawan challenged Jacqueline Fernandez to lift John Abraham. The actress surprised everyone with her sincere attempt. But John proved to be the real ‘Hulk’ as he scooped Varun in his arms, while Jacqueline piggybacked. Talk about muscle power! Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Jolt to NMC: Scania shifts green buses.description: Nagpur: Swedish bus maker Scania Commercial Vehicles India Pvt Ltd has reportedly moved out 24 of 25 ethanol-run buses from the city, burying the Nagpur Municipal Corporation’s (NMC) plan to resume country’s first green city bus service. Scania has also gone in for arbitration in its dispute with the civic body regarding termination of service. After discontinuing the service on August 13, 2018, Scania has kept its 25 buses at a yard in Hingna MIDC. TOI learnt Scania was shifting buses to another place a couple of days ago. When NMC officials checked, they found only one bus at the yard. “Scania should have informed NMC before shifting the buses. We will once again check the agreement and take necessary steps,” the officials said. NMC sources said Scania might have shifted the buses either to Hyderabad or Bengaluru. “Scania may also shift the remaining one bus out of city or keep it here for demonstration,” sources said. City MP and Union minister for road transport and highways Nitin Gadkari had held a series of meetings with Scania officials to resume the service. It was his pet project. NMC had launched the project as it was suggested by Gadkari. However, Scania refused to resume the service. NMC then planned to restart it by roping in a new operator. Plan was that the new operator will buy buses from Scania. Sources added talks between NMC and Scania failed as the latter refused to sell buses at depreciated value. “Pune-based Travel Time Car Rental Pvt Ltd, one of NMC’s red bus operators, had agreed to buy the buses and restart service. Plan could have materialized if Scania had agreed to sell buses at depreciated value,” the sources said. In an another shocker for NMC, Scania has gone in for arbitration. Before discontinuing the service, Scania had filed a petition in the district court and succeeded in getting an order to restrict NMC from forfeiting its bank guarantee of Rs 7.50 crore. NMC then began efforts for a settlement. Scania had demanded payment with GST which the NMC refused. Therefore, NMC did not pay anything to Scania from July 1, 2017, till termination. NMC was confident of resolving payment issues with Scania as well as resume the service. NMC officials said counsel AR Patil has been appointed arbitrator to resolve issues. “Scania filed a petition in High Court seeking arbitrator. HC ordered appointment of arbitrator on April 26,” the officials said. Scania did not respond to TOI’s mail seeking comments. Former mayor and corporator Pravin Datke said appropriate action will be taken against Scania as well as the officials of NMC’s city transport department. “NMC has bank guarantee of Rs 7.50 crore and payment of Rs 11 crore. We will check legal provisions and take action againt Scania.” “It is very unfortunate that Scania did not even give any intimation to us. The officials are also equally responsible for this. In fact, the negligence of officials resulted into discontinuation of the project. I will request the civic chief to initiate action against responsible officials immediately,” he said. Scania has parked three ethanol-run buses at its yard situated out of the city at Gondkhairi. These buses were not part of Green Bus service. Scania might also shift these buses to Bengaluru in coming days. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Five girls, one woman die after private.description: NAGPUR: Five girls and a 45-year-old woman died after the private taxi in which they were travelling plunged into Chulbandh river from a bridge in Bhandara district on Tuesday. Another three were seriously injured in the accident. The taxi was heading towards Lakhandur from Sakoli when one of it’s tyre burst. The vehicle, which was apparently driven at top speed, veered towards the bridge railing and broke through it to crash down. The vehicle, which had 15 passengers, fell 50 feet, leaving it heavily damaged. A 12-year-old girl, Sheetal Raut, and Sharda Gotaphode, 45, were among those killed in the accident. A student among the dead was heading to take admission in a college. Three seriously injured were rushed to Bhandara district hospital, while others were taken to sub-district hospital at Sakoli. Nearly 60% of Vidarbha\u2019s orange orc.description: NAGPUR: Changing weather conditions in Vidarbha over the past few years have spelt doom for orange cultivation in the region. In the near seven-decade history of orange plantations here, this is the first time that an alarming 60% orange orchards have gone completely dry and, for all purposes, died this year. The loss is stark in Warud tehsil of Amravati district followed by Katol and Narkhed tehsils of Nagpur district. For the first time, big and rich farmers are talking about selling off their lands and switching to other occupations. The vagaries of weather, scanty and erratic rains in last two years coupled with prolonged high temperatures throughout May and delayed pre-monsoon rains this year are responsible for this unheard-of plight of orange farmers. The loss caused to the ambia bahar crop alone (which fruits in September) is being pegged at about Rs1,620 crore. (mrig bahar, the other crop, fruits from February to April). However, the loss due to orchards (15-20 years) dying completely cannot be monetarily pegged. Shridhar Thakre, one of the Maha Orange directors and a big farmer, told TOI that he had stopped going to the orchards as he could not see the condition of the trees. He owns a 20-acre land with 3,500 orange trees in Talegaon village (Ashti) in Wardha district with irrigation facilities. But there is no water in the wells. The water table has gone below 1,000ft. “It is for the first time that the temperatures continuously hovered between 44 degrees Celsius to 47.5 degrees in the month of May. This year, there has been no pre-monsoon showers too. Neither the agriculture nor the revenue department has visited the orchards even once,” said Thakre. Rajendra Thakre from Benoda Shahid village in Warud tehsil says he has incurred a Rs1.5 crore loss this year. “I am 58 years old and have never seen such a situation in 30 years of agriculture. I have no option but to sell the land,” he said. All four of Thakre’s wells have gone bone dry. He tried bringing water from Paknala dam about 11km from the orchard by spending Rs18 lakh but the water in the dam too dried out soon. “Electricity supply at odd hours — night and afternoon — doesn’t allow proper irrigation,” he said. Ramhesh Jichkar, who heads the Vidarbha Agriculture and Allied Producers Association and has oranges in 30 acres in Nagziri in Warud tehsil, says that 30% of his orchard has been affected. The water table here too has gone below 1,000ft. An average orange tree needs about 240 litres per day. “Past three years has a rain deficit. Where will we get water from,” he asked. Taj Khan, who has orchards in 200 acres and is a trader as well in Shahpur village, says that he deepened a water reservoir using own money so that “all can benefit but no rain means storage has been less”. “I have a farm pond too but when there is no rain there is no water to store too,” he said. Small farmers from Madhav Taiwade (Jamgaon), Ganesh Dhote (Dawsa), Rambhau Kubade, Devnarayan Chaudhary and Durgabai Galbale (Umtha), Ramuji Deshbhratar (Arambi) — all in Narkhed Taluka — just point to their dry orchards. Among the many farmers TOI spoke with, only Manoj Jawanjal, a Maha Orange director and an organic orange grower, and Anil Junghare from Katol have managed to keep their orchards green. “I have farm ponds and bore wells. I pull out the water from wells also and store in ponds with polythene sheath at the bottom to prevent seepage,” said Junghare. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nurture your creativity, give wings to i.description: The scope of animation runs across all domains of the entertainment industry. With the competition in this industry getting fiercer every day, the future of animation is huge and promising. Other than being an art of drawing cartoons, animation and multimedia have emerged as an industry with tremendous revenues. The excessive use of special effects has helped animation get a hold over movies, television and advertising sectors. It is one of the most concrete, lucrative and demanding career options which serves both entertainment and education industries alike. Those in this profession create animation and visual effects for films, video games, television, mobile devices, and other forms of media using illustrations and software programmes. Animators also create graphics and develop storyboards, drawings and illustrations. They create, plan, and script animated narrative sequences, and assist with background design as well as production coordination. If you are looking to enter this profession, the possible roadmap is to enroll into degree programmes or certificate courses offering exhaustive understanding of animation, graphics & web designing and multimedia. It is advised to build a portfolio in order to showcase artistry and creative and technical skills. Gaining work experience and maintaining your proficiency is of utmost importance. Ashita Reuben, co-founder and creative head of Coffee Beans Studio, said the best part about the job is feeling satisfied at the end of the day and receiving praise from clients. She said, “The animation industry in India is expected to grow at a pace faster than any other industry. As a career option, it is a field where you can fulfil your dream of having fun as you work.” The skills required to foray into this field include nurturing creativity and appreciation of aesthetics. An animator must have the ability to express ideas through drawings. This demands a good visual imagination along with appropriate sense of colour. Being able to use computerols to generate visuals, while utilizing knowledge of mathematics and physics is invaluably helpful in all aspects of this industry. You can constantly hone your craft by engaging with different projects. You should also be able to constantly update yourself with dynamic technologies. Work opportunities for quality animators and related professionals like graphic designer, multimedia and game developer, character designer, key frame animator, 3D modeler and layout artist exist in sectors of advertising, online and print news media, film and television, cartoon production, theater, video gaming and e-learning at large. This booming industry houses opportunities with government as well as private sectors. It has an open field of employment opportunities in animation studios as story board artists, animation or character artists, compositing artists, video and audio specialists, visualizing, texture and lighting artists and editors in film labs. XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX Why opt for the subject High demand for animators Interesting work environment Work in a range of industries, from gaming to film animation Constant engagement of your imagination XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX Expert View Venu Dindi An industry full of creative people For a career path in animation, gaming, VFX or motion graphics, you need to be highly creative with a logical thinking cap. This challenging career allows you to work on a wide range of projects in various industries. To be successful you must be creative, detail-oriented, patient, and have the ability to see the product you are creating even before it gets put to paper or computer screen. If you enjoy being creative, can work independently, and enjoy bringing characters to life, animation may be a career choice worth considering. All the way, you are expected to be creative and artistic, with communication and time management skills. You must have computer expertise and the ability to use animation and video editing skills. Jobs related to your degree in animation include character modeller, rigging artist, animator, texture artist, games developer, graphic designer, illustrator, VFX artist, web designer Etc. Animation is a great way to make a living. It’s an industry full of creative people who get excited about what they do. Starting out, expect to put in long hours to hone your skills. Be prepared to move around a bit to go where there’s work. Be respectful of those you work with and you’ll find many artists who are more than happy to share their knowledge and experience. The future for 3D animators as a career is wide and varied. It encompasses a wide range of industries, from working at a production studio, to small animation companies, to ad agencies, to video game manufacturers to enjoying job works as an independent freelancer. Design companies rely on logos and corporate animations. You’d be amazed at how many television commercials and logos are 3D creations. Animation is opening in as many sectors you can think. You could also work at advertising agencies, design companies, animated television series, film doing background scene or creating animation web-series for YouTube or ad-series for social media. A few brave souls even decide to go it alone and make their own films. Most employers prefer to hire candidates who have a bachelor’s degree or diploma in animation, computer graphics, fine arts, or a related discipline. Choosing a mentor with strong industry exposure is most important rather than just joining institutes with glossy makeups, theoretical classes, costly branding, interiors or happening environments. In the 25 years or so that I have been involved in animation, I have worked with over a dozen different studios ranging from 5 to 250 in staff. The one constant in all these studios is the human dynamism. All studios are successful because of the talent they collect. No matter what your role is, you should always be aware of those around you and learn from their collective experience. Animation, gaming and VFX is a collaborative process and everyone working on a project adds value. Respect others but don’t be afraid to make your job count. If everyone does that, then you get a synergy that is impossible to describe. (Dindi is founder director of Dindiwood Media Entertainment Pvt Ltd) XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX List of colleges Arena Animation, Nagpur Courses offered: Broadcast editing, 3D modelling with max, advance 3D animation (for more info, contact institute) Duration: 5 months for broadcast editing, 4 months for 3D modelling with max Admission procedure: Direct admission after Std X and XII Source: Admission desk Toon One, Nagpur Courses offered: BSc in multimedia and animation, diploma in animation Duration: 3 years for BSc and 1.5 years for diploma Admission procedure: Direct Source: Institute website MAAC, Nagpur Courses offered: 3D animation and film making (For more courses, contact institute) Duration: 2 years Admission procedure: Direct Source: Nital Sawde, centre head This list is not exhaustive and should not be considered as the endorsement of the institute. Students are advised to check with relevant education authorities before taking admission XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX PROFESSIONALS SPEAK If you want to study animation, you must have broad and clear thinking. One must be creative with whatever they do. They must have a vision in their minds which is unique and stands out among others Mudit Bhatnagar I chose this field because as an artist, I felt animation and film design would let me explore a lot of things. With evolving industries, I also get a chance to evolve, learn, try something new rather than just using pencil and paper Shubham Banerjee People should be aware of their interests and abilities. Hard work and dedication are required everywhere if you seek success. If you keep in mind your abilities and passions, this field can be fun and interesting. It will help evolve your creative thinking Himangi Sharma Try to fit in with diverse people and not fall in love with your own creations too much. Asking questions about how to perform a particular task rather than just sitting there mindlessly would be the advice I’d like to give upcoming artists Selvyn Quiney Animation is a very vast industry. It consists of so many various fields and is also expanding rapidly. Anyone from any field can join in animation. There are no regulations. It consists of around 32 to 50 career options Abhishek Suresh Acharya (Compiled by Manshika Vaikkath) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. In Video:Actress Urmila Matondkar meets Rahul Gandhi, joins CongressDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\nAshwamedh staged at Ram Nagar Ground i.description: The tale and triumph of five rulers — Chandragupta Maurya, Harshvardhana, Prithviraj Chauhan, Krishnadevaraya and Swargnarayana — was beautifully narrated through Hindi mega play Ashwamedh, which was recently staged at Ram Nagar Ground. Nagpur’s theatre aficionados were enchanted with superlative performances of the artistes and the gripping story kept the audiences on the edge of their seats. What added grandeur to this two-hour show were colourful dance sequences and the magnificent set designs. Director of the play Dr Vinod Indurkar said, “The concept and technique of mahanatya is different than normal plays. You have a narrator, elaborate backdrops and recorded dialogues, which make for an entertaining theatrical treat for the viewers. It is overwhelming to see audience being so receptive and a good turnout is a great motivation for a creative person.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PWD transforms 80 govt structures into g.description: Nagpur: Setting an example for private properties, the state’s Public Works Department (PWD) has converted 80 government buildings into ‘green buildings’, and also obtained ratings from the Green Rating for Integrated Habitat Assessment (GRIHA) Council in Vidarbha. One new building has also been constructed as per green building norms, and there are plans for 136 new green buildings in the region. PWD chief engineer Ulhas Debadwar told TOI the plan is to convert 1,500 existing government buildings into green buildings in entire state by 2021. “Some 300 buildings were selected in phase-I, of which works on 201 has been completed. Works on remaining buildings are likely to be completed soon. Target is to cover 525 more buildings in phase-II across the state. MoU for phase-II was executed with GRIHA Council in the city recently,” he said. Under PWD-GRIHA green building Initiative, MoU was executed between the two agencies for transforming 300 existing government buildings, including 121 from Vidarbha, into green buildings in January. The team from GRIHA inspected the buildings and suggested the works. Registration of buildings was done in February. PWD completed works on 201, including 80 in Vidarbha, in three months. GRIHA teams conducted inspection and gave ratings this month. PWD superintending engineer Vidyadhar Sardeshmukh told TOI PWD has also started construction of all new government buildings as per green building norms. “Target is to construct 201 new buildings, including 137 in Vidarbha, as per green building norms. Works on two buildings, of which one in Nagpur division at Chandrapur and other in Pune division, has been completed. We constructed Van Bhavan at Chandrapur under the project and got five-star rating,” he said. Sardeshmukh added the building of Maharashtra National Law University (MNLU) being constructed by PWD near Waranga will be a complete green building. “We are constructing buildings at GMCH, Mayo Hospital and other locations too with the same concept,” he said. Sardeshmukh said PWD transformed some historic existing buildings like Vidhan Bhavan, Rajbhavan, Ravibhavan, Hyderabad House etc in the city into green buildings under the project. “Main objective is to reduce power and water consumption, ensure safe disposal of sewage and garbage, reduce carbon emissions, conserve environment, and increase life of the structures. We are replacing all lights with LED and laying reflective paint on terrace to reduce power consumption inside the buildings,” he said. Sardeshmukh also said they plan to operate buildings on solar power after getting rating in phase-I. “Already, tenders for installation of solar power systems on 390 buildings have been floated in the state, of which 40 are in Nagpur division. Solar power systems will be installed in rest houses first like Ravibhavan, MLA Hostel etc in the city,” he said. Sardeshmukh said PWD will save around 2,200MW per annum used in government buildings after completion of phase-I works. GRIHA Council, a not-for-profit society jointly established by the ministry of new and renewable energy, and The Energy and Resources Institute (TERI) has claimed phase-I works resulted in annual reduction of 2,721 tonne of carbon emissions, which is equivalent to eliminating 600 vehicles from the roads in the state. NMC’s special purpose vehicle for Smart City project — Nagpur Smart and Sustainable City Development Corporation Limited — in association with Indian green building Council (IGBC) has planned to develop the city into the country’s Model Green City. The plan is to encourage and help in construction of all new buildings as per the norms of green buildings. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

NNTR drivers may get aid for new vehicle.description: NAGPUR: Looking at the pathetic condition of safari vehicles at Navegaon-Nagzira Tiger Reserve (NNTR), officials are aggressively working on a plan to help local drivers get financial assistance for purchase of new four wheelers. On Tuesday itself a gypsy broke down during the evening safari, forcing a tourist to walk 4km inside the core jungle. Forest officials are exploring options of negotiating a good deal with banks or getting funds through some government scheme. Poonam Pate, NNTR deputy director (core) said, “We are trying to see if a discounted rate of interest can be negotiated for vehicle loans. They did a similar thing in Tadoba and we are trying to work along the same route.” Another option for the forest officials is to dip into funds from some state or central government scheme. “That option is at a very preliminary stage and a bit of a remote possibility for now. But we are trying to find out if there is some kind of scheme where we can access funds for new vehicles,” said Pate. There are 43 vehicles plying in NNTR with a majority of them in bad shape. Many consider it a miracle that these vehicles don’t break down as often as they should. While pulling the plug on all these vehicles may seem the logical thing to do, forest officials say the solution isn’t practical. “This would mean taking away employment opportunities from villagers who reside here. They are not in a position to invest their own money to buy new vehicles. In fact, some of them may not even be in a position to get it financed either. These are ground realities that one needs to keep in mind before taking any decision and that is why we are exploring options to help them,” said Pate. Maintenance of vehicles to prolong their life is also out of the question at this point of time. Sources say these vehicles are literally running on ‘prayers’ and there is no scope for any kind of mechanical intervention to salvage the vehicles. All city buses to run on CNG by fiscal y.description: NAGPUR: In a move that will put a major check on air pollution in city, transport department of Nagpur Municipal Corporation is to convert all 431 city buses from diesel-run to CNG-run. It will also induct five electric buses in 2019-20. Jitendra Kukde, chairman of NMC’s transport committee, mentioned this in his budget of Rs277.84 crore for 2019-20 presented before the standing committee chairman Pradip Pohane. The expected expenditure of the department will be Rs 278.41 crore. Now, Pohane will include transport panel’s budget in his budget to be presented in the general body. Kukde has projected a revenue of Rs 90 crore from sale of tickets while remaining Rs 188.41 crore funding from standing committee. The panel chief said the department will earn Rs 25 lakh from bus shelters advertisements. Following the vision of Union transport minister Nitin Gadkari to promote ecofriendly public transport, Kukde has proposed to convert all 235 standard buses, 150 midi and 45 mini buses to run on CNG. Already the civic body had converted one bus to run on CNG, he said. Kukde also announced migration of all NMC’s owned four-wheelers, including mayor’s car, to CNG. “By end of this financial year, entire Aapli Bus fleet will run on CNG,” Kukde claimed. About strengthening Aapli Bus service in congested areas like Itwari, Mahal, Mominpura, Kukde said operation of mini-buses will start by next month. Already, 15 buses have arrived and remaining 30 will join the Aapli bus fleet soon. “Even MahaMetro has approached the civic body for starting feeder bus service from its stations. We will provide mini-buses for the purpose,” he said. He announced provision of free travel for specially-abled persons and women kin of martyrs. He said civic body will bear the expenditure for martyrs’ kin under ‘Mi Jijao Mata scheme,’ while state’s social welfare department will fund specially-abled persons’ travel. Kukde has proposed to provide common mobility card that could be used both on Metro as well as Aapli Buses. He also proposed to set up water ATMs near major bus shelters and earmarked Rs 2 crore for the purpose. Already the service has been introduced at a bus shelter near KDK College and is getting good response, he claimed. He also proposed to introduce the facility to buy tickets for Aapli Bus on mobile phones. For this, NMC is tying up with a private operator Chalo App. Using this app, commuters can also locate the bus and see timetable, eliminating need to wait. About state government’s economic survey that shows NMC had earned Rs 84 lakh profit from city bus operation in last financial year, Kukde and transport manager Shivajirao Jagtap said NMC had suffered Rs 76.5 crore loss. NMC notice to Scania for shifting buses.description: NAGPUR: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) city transport department on Tuesday served notice to Swedish bus maker Scania Commercial Vehicles India Private Ltd for moving out its ethanol-run buses from the city without any intimation. The civic body also questioned how Scania dismantled the ethanol fuel dispensing unit at Khapri. TOI had, on Tuesday, reported Scania had shifted 24 of the 25 ethanol buses, probably to Bengaluru, putting paid to NMC’s plan to resume the country’s first green city bus service. Chairman of city transport committee Bunty Kukde conducted an investigation and found only one bus was left in the city. Following Kukde’s directives, city transport manager Shivaji Jagtap sent notice to Torbjorn Glad, CEO of Scania’s special purpose vehicle — SST Sustainable Transport Solutions. “It is a very serious issue that you unilaterally shifted buses from the city. The buses were registered with RTO as public transport vehicles. Therefore, the permission of appropriate authority was mandatory, which was not ensured. Therefore, we will take appropriate action against you after verifying legal provisions,” Jagtap said. Kukde said NMC will inform arbitrator AR Patil about the incident. “Scania had stopped the service unilaterally. NMC had refused to accept termination notice of Scania. It seems the company was not interested in serving the city, local people and country. We will take appropriate action, as we have Scania’s bank guarantee and payment,” he said. AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Doctors\u2019 strike total, only emergen.description: NAGPUR: A 24-hour complete shutdown was observed by private hospitals, clinics and nursing homes from 6am on Monday to demand a central law to protect doctors from violence by patients’ relatives. In line with a nationwide strike called by Indian Medical Association (IMA), most doctors kept Outdoor Patient Departments (OPDs) of their hospitals closed for the day. Only emergency services and casualty wards were functioning. Diagnostic services and pathologies were also closed for the day. Doctors practicing ayurveda, homeopathy and other schools of medicines also kept their clinics closed to express solidarity with their counterparts practicing allopathy. While private doctors observed the strike, residents as well as senior doctors at Government Medical Colleges across the region worked with black ribbons on their hands. Nagpur, being a medical hub in Central India, receives patients from nearby areas of Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Telangana and Andhra Pradesh. Many patients coming from the rural parts of these states had to spend the day waiting in hospitals due to the strike. Emergency cases were given due attention and admitted to CCUs. “Six emergency cases were admitted in Critical Care Unit (CCU) on Monday. Our intentions were clear that patients should not suffer due to our agitation. Patients who came for routine check-ups were given alternative appointments promptly,” said Dr Anoop Marar, director of Orange City Hospital and Research Center. Paediatrician Dr Uday Bodhankar said that cases coming from faraway places were treated. “People from other states come with serious cases to Nagpur. Moreover, paediatric cases are vulnerable and we cannot avoid them. So, several cases were treated, and many patients were admitted,” he said. Nagpur IMA president Dr Kush Jhunjhunwala said doctors registered protest peacefully without creating problems for patients. “The one-day strike was peaceful. We made patients aware about the tough situation doctors face when patients’ relatives take law in their hands. Services will resume from Tuesday morning, and patients earlier scheduled for check-ups on Monday will be given priority,” he said. Meanwhile, members of IMA gathered at the IMA Hall on Monday morning, raised slogans and highlighted placards against the West Bengal government. “Doctors usually do not stretch the agitations so long. We are there to serve the people. But the attitude of the state’s chief minister was very disappointing. So, we had to take a stand nationwide,” said Dr Sanjay Deshpande. Even as OPDs were shut, doctors kept hospitals and waiting areas open for patients. Hospital staff told them about the strike and arranged for alternate appointments. On Monday evening, resident doctors in West Bengal called off their strike as their negotiations with the state government were successful. IMA central committee will issue directives about the future course of action to local units on Tuesday. In Yavatmal, doctors took out a silent march. “Leaders of various organizations strongly condemned the barbaric attacks on doctors on duty,” said Dr Anoop Kothari, president of IMA’s Yavatmal unit. The strike received support from social organizations like Junior Chamber, Rotary Club, Chamber of Commerce, Druggists Association, Maheshwari Samaj, Agrawal Samaj, Bar Association, Arogya Bharati, Banjara Sangh, and several others. In Chandrapur, doctors attached to IMA Chandrapur chapter kept all non-essential medical services, including OPDs, closed. IMA national working committee member Dr Mangesh Gulwade declared zero-tolerance policy against violence against doctors. A delegation of doctors met resident deputy collector Ghansham Bhugaonkar and submitted a memorandum. The World Medical Association has also passed a resolution against violence at health care establishments and urged stronger legislation against the menace. Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi. BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Nagpur\u2019s Confidence Petroleum plans.description: Nagpur: City-based Confidence Petroleum, dubbed as the largest stand-alone auto LPG supplier, plans to invest Rs500 crore for expansion in the next two years. Rs250 crore will be pumped in every year. The company, which has been trading in the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) since 1995, also got listed at the National Stock Exchange (NSE) last week. The company’s share is now being traded at Rs38.5 with a trading volume of around 3 lakh shares. It has a paid up value of Re 1. Talking to TOI in light of the listing at NSE, chairman Nitin Khara said the company has 196 auto LPG filling stations in different states. There are plans to take it to 500 stations in Nagpur where there are five centres which would be doubled during the expansion drive. Apart from Maharashtra, the company plans to have additional auto LPG stations in Tamil Nadu, West Bengal, Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh. “The company already has its presence in most of these states, which would be further strengthened,” said Khara. Apart from the main cities in these states, there are plans to start auto LPG filling centres in tehsils and Tier III towns also. This will happen in Maharashtra, too, he added. Out of the Rs500 crore planned to be invested, Rs300 crore will go into setting up a bottling plant. Confidence Petroleum is at present a debt free company and would be funding it expansion through internal accruals apart from raising loans. On the listing at NSE he said it was pending because shares which formed a major stake held in his mother’s name remained in physical form. Khara said that as his mother expired in 2011, it took time to settle the formalities related to the will after which the shares held in her name were dematised. Listing in NSE was only possible after that. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\nCultural fest organised at Chitnavis C.description: Nagpurians enjoyed an amazing collaboration of musical theatre along with a fusion of vocal and instrumental recitals at a cultural fest organised at Chitnavis Centre recently.  The event began with Charles Dickens’ English play — A Christmas Carol — directed by well-known city theatre artiste Vikash Khurana. The superlative performances, gripping storyline, peppy songs and a strong message of the play impressed the ardent theatre lovers of the city.  The ghazals rendered by Prasanna Joshi were no less impressive. An evidently elated guru of the singer Ustad Akeel Ahmed, sported a benign smile during the performance. Later, the instrumental fusion by maestros Salil Bhatt (on satvik veena) and Matthias Muller (on guitar) made for a befitting culmination to this cultural treat. Divisional commissioner Anoop Kumar and Maharashtra’s principal secretary (urban development), Manu Kumar Srivastava were spotted enjoying the cultural treat. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nHeart-wrenching tale enthralled Nagpur.description: A Marathi play Vyakti aani Valli was recently staged at Dr Vasantrao Deshpande Hall. Nagpur’s theatre buffs enjoyed a mélange of various characters and their eccentricities. Theatrical adaption of a book penned by legendary litterateur P L Deshpande, the rib-tickling play — directed by Chandrakant Kulkarni — had popular names from Marathi film and theatre world in the star cast. Actor-director Mahesh Manjrekar, Sunil Barve, Bhau Kadam, Anand Ingale etc. swept the audience off their feet with their impeccable comic timing and strong dialogue delivery. Needless to say, the auditorium reverberated with loud applause when the show ended. Gotya Sawant also garnered praises as a sutradhar. Former Union cabinet minister, Vilas Muttemwar with wife Chhaya, former Maha ministers Anil Deshmukh and Ranjit Deshmukh with wife Rupa enjoyed the play. Divisional Commissioner Anoop Kumar and IPS officers Deepali Masirkar and Rohan Samant were also spotted. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gangster Vijay Mohod murdered over gambl.description: NAGPUR: The speculation around gangster Vijay Mohod, 32, ended around 7.30 am on Monday when his body was found with numerous stab wounds at Vela Hari village in the outskirts of the city. The murder, over rivalry on gambling dens which are now controlled by top goons in the city as cops are turning a blind eye on them, likely had taken place a day ago. Mohod, having two murder charges against him, is learnt to have suffered 39 stab wounds on his body. His murder may now trigger a gang war between his close aides and ‘Beats group’ whose members, including Abhay Raut, is suspected to be involved. The case has been transffered to crime branch. Mohod was kidnapped a day ago from a Saoji eatery allegedly by Raut and his aides in a car. Around 20-25 people had come to abduct Mohod in three to four cars. It is learnt both Mohod and Raut wanted to maximize profits from the gambling dens they were operating. Raut is learnt to be operating one at Kharsoli while Mohod’s was at Dhamna. Sources said Raut wanted Mohod to amalgamate their illegal businesses and share more profits which Mohod was resisting. Raut possibly lured Mohod with an offer to see a new place at Kharsoli where they could start a new den. Mohod was with his friends Rupesh Bonde and others at the eatery near Outer Ring Road from where he was taken in a car. Later, his family members and friends got a call from a close aide of Mohod that he had been murdered. Police searched for him on Sunday but found nothing. A case of kidnapping was registered at Hudkeshwar police station in the wee hours of Monday. “We received a response from cyber team that both of Mohod’s cellphones were showing presence near Vela Hari village. Shortly afterwards, we found his body on the roadside,” said PI Sandeep Bhosale of Hudkeshwar police station. Raut, close to arrested gangster-turned-bookie Swapnil Salunkhe, is learnt to have inflicted 44 stab wounds on his last victim Palash Diwte in October last year. Though several other names had cropped up, Hudkeshwar police insisted Raut alone was responsible for the murder. Raut got bail in this case too. After his release, he began asserting his influence. Another theory is that Mohod had threatened one Dilip for having beaten Sarang Thaokar over certain monetary dues. A relative of Mohod said Sarang owed around Rs 1.5 lakh to Salunkhe that he had lost in cricket betting. Dilip, close to Salunkhe, was threatening Sarang when Mohod intervened. Mohod had taken Sarang to Salunkhe asking him not to bother him for dues any more. Despite Mohod’s intervention, Dilip had thrashed Sarang which was not taken lightly by Mohod. Top goons like Diwakar Kottulwar and his aides are also operating a major gambling den at Fetri under Hingna police station. Following a dispute at his den, Mohod had kidnapped gangster Maroti Nuwah around two months ago at gunpoint. Diwakar too had ensured no other gambling dens came up in his vicinity. Mystery over Salunkhe’s arrest four days ago Nagpur: Swapnil Salunkhe was arrested by Pachpaoli police on June 13 for an offence of assault on cops registered in 2017. He was earlier rounded up by crime branch in January 2017 but was let off after a senior officer intervened. His arrest in the same case one and half years later Salunkhe when there are 11 accused named is baffling. Two more brothers of dreaded gangster Ippa, Naushad and Irshad too are at large in the case. Salunkhe was not on good terms with Vijay Mohod who was murdered on Sunday. The prime suspect in the murder, Abhay Raut, is learnt to be close to Salunkhe. Asaduddin Owaisi.description: NEW DELHI: Asaduddin Owaisi, president of All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM), was greeted with slogans of 'Jai Shri Ram', 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' and 'Vande Mataram' on Tuesday as he went on to take oath as a member of the 17th Lok Sabha here. Owaisi, a Member of Parliament (MP) from Hyderabad constituency, in response, said, "Jai Bheem, Jai Meem, Takbeer Allahu Akbar, Jai Hind" while concluding his oath. Later, responding to opposition's gesture, Owaisi told ANI, "I think, it's good that they remember such things after seeing me. I hope they remember our constitution and the deaths of children in Muzaffarpur as well. I will keep an eye on them." Besides, Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) lone MP from Punjab's Sangrur, Bhagwant Mann, raised 'Inquilab Zindabad' slogans at the end of his oath-taking ceremony earlier today. #WATCH: Slogans of Bharat Mata ki Jai and Vande Mataram raised in the Lok Sabha as AIMIM MP from Hyderabad Asaduddi… https://t.co/6QTgnFYG6x— ANI (@ANI) 1560854690000This comes after BJP MP from Bhopal Pragya Singh Thakur ended her oath taking ceremony with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan on Monday. Subsequently, every BJP member continued to raise slogans. Moreover, chants of 'Jai Shri Ram' marked the oath-taking by minister Babual Supriyo, elected from Asansol in West Bengal, where the chanting of the slogan became a political issue during the recent elections. The furore over 'Jai Shri Ram' slogan started in the state after West Bengal chief minister Banerjee lost her cool when a group of men chanted 'Jai Shri Ram' as her convoy was passing through Bhatpara area in North 24 Parganas district earlier this month. \nRaisoni College organises get-together.description: A get-together organised recently by the Raisoni College of Commerce, Science and Technology was high on fun and camaraderie.  The power-packed event had many entertaining acts and interesting games. Divided in different teams, students donned various superhero tees and brought forth their competitive streak in various games like truth or dare and musical chairs. Impromptu colourful dances, singing and humourous skits added entertainment to the do. The Raisonians, being the sport they are, performed all the tasks with great enthusiasm. The youngsters later were spotted clicking selfies and sharing light moments , bonding over refreshments. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kids steal the show in dramas staged by.description: NAGPUR: The auditorium of Deshpande Hall was filled with laughter and enthusiasm as the tiny tots took over the stage to present a play titled ‘Chor Ko Pakdo’ and ‘Magic Within’ organized by Fundoos Theatre. This two plays were organized after a 10-day workshop with children in the age group of 7-14 to developing their holistic skills, intellect, speech and confidence. This was the first theatre workshop under Fundoos. The little ones dressed in colourful costumes and funky hairstyle delivered perfect comic timings, dance performance in between and good dialogue delivery. The play offered a dose of laughter and some philosophy that acted as a good learning experience for the children. Needless to say their parents enjoyed it. Rupa Khare, mother of an actor-child Riddhi, said, “I am glad I admitted my daughter in this workshop, she was always fond of acting and watching her perform today made me a proud mother.” Ashlesh Jamre, director of the play, said, “In the workshop we taught the children about basic details of acting and theatre, we taught them about Navraas, stage presence, dialogue delivery and how to overcome stage fear. They being children under the age of 14, it was a difficult as well as easy task at the same time to mold them according to the character of the play.” “They have greater imagination power which helped me to write the script. It was a good experience working and teaching them and it also helps to develop soft skills and intellect of the young minds,” Jamre said. Madhavi Kavishwar, producer said, “Acting and holistic skills go hand-in-hand. This theatre workshop has helped the children to develop and express themselves in the field of theatre.” Kinjal Khare, 10, said, “It was a fun learning experience for me, I am thinking to attend more such workshops in the future. Right from make-up and costumes I really enjoyed the process and I am excited to perform.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sighted: \u2018Rare\u2019 Black Capped K.description: NAGPUR: Sighting of Black Capped Kingfisher at Tadoba Lake has given bird enthusiasts a reason to smile, as it is not often that this species is spotted. On June 10, Amit Dixit, along with his friends and family, was on his regular wildlife safari at Tadoba when they sighted this species. Dixit, who was accompanied by his friend Amit Maywad, chanced upon this bird in the morning and immediately knew it was special. “I heard the bird call and that got my attention. It was there sitting on a branch and the colours struck me as something different. I knew it was a Kingfisher, but I was not sure which type. I zoomed in with my camera and took multiple photos of it,” said Dixit, whose wife Shweta, daughter Rucha and even mother Vaijayanti are bird enthusiasts. Once back home, Dixit scoured the internet to find out which species it exactly was. “Then, I found out that it was the Black Capped Kingfisher and other senior bird enthusiasts that I spoke to said others must be made aware of it,” said Dixit. Black Capped Kingfisher resides mainly in coasts of India and Bangladesh. It has a black cap, white collar, deep purplish-blue upper parts, black coverts contrasting with blue secondaries. In flight, it shows bright blue rump & prominent white patches at base of primaries. Raju Kasambe, an avid bird researcher and assistant director of Education and Conservation Education Centre at Bombay Natural History Society, said that the bird is seen usually in this area. “I would not exactly call it rare because people have seen it regularly. The Black Headed Kingfisher is a different species and is found in Sumatra,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

State yet to assess damage.description: NAGPUR: The state government has taken no cognisance of the loss in oranges despite being aware of the situation. A group of leaders led by former MLA Ashish Deshmukh had met district collector Ashwin Mudgal more than a fortnight back and appraised him about the dwindling water scenario in orange orchards. In their representation, they had demanded 90% subsidy on drip irrigation, supply of water through tankers in highly dried areas for irrigation and advising state agriculture farmers to guide in mulching. “The collector had assured us to forward our demands to the chief minister. Unlike western Maharashtra, Vidarbha’s horticulture farmers have got no compensation for drought in areas like Kalmeshwar, Katol and Narkhed,” said Deshmukh. The state agriculture department has also not conducted any survey yet to assess the extent of the orchard drying. R Bhonsale, joint director agriculture, Nagpur division, told TOI that the survey can be done only on directions of the district collector. “We have no such instructions yet,” he said. New state agriculture minister Anil Bonde said that he took meetings of agriculture secretaries and directors, and told them to generate their own data on affected areas without depending on the revenue department. “Agriculture department officials should remain connected with farmers and always have an estimate of any losses about all crops,” he said. Though most farmers are claiming that their orchards incurred permanent damage, MS Ladaniya, the director Central Citrus Research Institute (CCRI), has denied it. “It is temporary drying. Even if a few green leaves are present on a tree, it can be revived through rain. But this is possible only in the areas where there is heavy and deep soil in orange growing areas in Morshi, Warud and Katol tehsils. Oranges in shallow and light soils will not survive such drought,” he said. Ladaniya claims that CCRI had issued advisories to orange growers to thin the fruits (remove half fruits) from trees to reduce the loss on a tree. The institute had also suggested mulching (covering of the tree bottom by grass, straw or even plastic) to prevent evaporation losses. This helps conserve water near the roots. “The state government needs to take the issue seriously. Farmers should be advised to retain moisture in soil and spend more money on it. Last monsoon had a 23% deficit. If this persists, this year too the situation will be grave. There should be a water grid for proper distribution. It is an expensive proposition but is one of the solutions,” said Ladaniya. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mohod stabbed to death in running car, a.description: NAGPUR: The two alleged assailants, Abhay Raut and Suraj Karlawar, were arrested by crime branch on Monday for murdering gangster Vijay Mohod on Sunday. The accused allegedly told the crime branch that the victim was stabbed to death inside a moving car. The two, produced before the court on Tuesday, were remanded to police custody for five days. Police said the car in which Mohod was stabbed to death would be seized soon. The crime branch is now set to arrest Tidke. Investigating officer API Kiran Choughule of crime branch had sought 10 days remand custody for Raut and Karlawar. Mohod, having two murders and other offences against him including kidnapping of gangster Maroti Nuwah, was killed over operating gambling dens. He operated a gambling den at Dhamna and was opposing a new one at Kharsoli run by Raut, who now has three murder cases against him. Mohod wanted partnership in the gambling den at Kharsoli, which Raut wanted to expand. Mohod was taken to Kharsoli in a car by Raut, Karlawar and Nitin Tidke to see a place where the den could start soon. Karlawar was behind the wheels while Raut was seated beside him. Tidke, with whom Mohod had a fight at a bar at Butibori, was seated beside the driver. A heated exchange between Mohod and Raut suddenly led to the assault. Raut and Tidke repeatedly stabbed Mohod until he collapsed in the car, which is owned by a person identified as Vaid. Mohod’s body was dumped near Vela Hari village and the assailants sped away. DCP, crime, Nilesh Bharne said there may be bigger action awaiting the gang which is behind the murder. “We are contemplating various legal issues to book the assailants,” he said.
