\nStudents of ETC department of Yeshwant.description: It was time for the final year students of ETC department, Yeshwantrao Chavan College of Engineering, to bid goodbye to their college life. The farewell bash, which was organised recently on the college premises, was full of fun and nostalgia. Partying with their friends one last time, youngsters experienced a gamut of emotions. While outstation students were sad to leave the city, many seemed excited to join the companies they have been placed in through campus recruitment. Girls and boys didn’t forget to click numerous selfies and group snaps, which were instantly updated on their social media accounts. To add some more fun to the bash, various games were organised wherein seniors and juniors enthusiastically participated. Later, a leg-pulling session not only evoked plenty of laughter, but also proved to be a catalyst in making the bond stronger between the juniors and seniors. \u2018Lincoln\u2019s letter\u2019 throws.description: NAGPUR: Several insightful facets of life were thrown open during the Girish Gandhi Foundation-organized seminar on ‘Abraham Lincoln’s letter to the teacher: Today’s Perspective’ at Dhanwate Hall, Shankar Nagar, on Sunday.  The seminar concentrated on the teachings of Lincoln and the implementation of the same then and now. It also debated upon various ways, teachings and ethics taught to students nowadays. Senior journalist Shailesh Pandey, Mubarak Syed and Sandhya Pawar, both teachers were the panellists. Addressing the gathering, teacher Sandhya Pawar said, “ I want my students to be good human beings first. I don’t want to make my students learn, I want to educate them.” On a lighter vein, she said, “I believe if mobile phones were invented back in the time of Lincoln, he surely would have recommended against it.” Journalist Pande explained the topic to the audience and told them what it actually meant. He took the help of historical events like the American Civil War to explain his points as he went deeper into the subject. “The American Civil War was one of the greatest moral, constitutional and economic crisis in the world. Why? Because all men were considered equal except for South American men.” Pandey said, “Lincoln effectively addressed many problems in the world including inequality among men.” Picking up the topic right where Pandey left it, Mubarak Syed, “People often ask me why I chose to become a teacher to which I reply that it was never my choice. My father wanted me to become one.” Terming the role of a teacher as inspirational and motivational, Syed recalled an instance, “I once said to one of my students ‘you just walk forward ... I will be there behind you, supporting and encouraging you always’. That’s the sort of faith a teacher should instill in one’s student.” Rekha Dandige anchored the seminar. She explained the importance of a teacher in a child’s life and compared him to a father. “ Like a father has a very important role in the upbringing of a child, similarly a teacher too plays a vital role in moulding a child’s future,” she said. President of Girish Gandhi Foundation Shrikant Tidke proposed a vote of thanks. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Patients miss appointments, but show sol.description: NAGPUR: The one-day strike by private doctors in the city created problems for those patients who had sought prior appointments for regular check-ups and treatment. Unaware about the strike, patients reached clinics as per their scheduled time only to be told by the on-duty staff that doctors will not be available for the day. “I thought only corporate hospitals are on strike and not the smaller clinics. So, I came for my regular check-up. The clinic was open but I was told that non-essential services have been withdrawn for a day. I was given an appointment for tomorrow morning,” said Prakash Kulkarni, a senior citizen from Narendra Nagar. There are many hospitals in Dhantoli where patients come from different places with prior appointments months in advance. Many of these hospitals claimed that they informed patients about the strike and rescheduled their appointments. Many corporate hospitals also made it a point to check and treat patients coming from rural areas and other states to avoid inconvenience. “In fact, we admitted 17 patients today. We conducted three surgeries on trauma patients who came all the way from Betul and Chandrapur,” said Dr Sameer Paltewar of Meditrina hospital. “The OPD was closed. Not a single patient was checked. In fact, patients, too, cooperated,” he added. Non-availability of diagnostic services was a major problem for patients. Staff and technicians were available at CT scan centres and pathology labs. In many cases, they took blood samples and conducted scans but they refused to give reports before Tuesday if it was not an emergency. “Reports of several diagnostic scans and blood tests were provided instantly. We were asked to come tomorrow if it was not a case of emergency,” said Sushila Bhagat, a patient. Most of the patients expressed their solidarity with the doctors. “They are life givers and nobody has the right to attack them. How can we lose a trained doctor who can save hundreds of lives in a mob fury? There should be a central law with provisions of strict punishment in case of violence against doctors,” said Dr Dilip Dabir, a retired professor. Rotary Vision financial aid for needy st.description: NAGPUR: The Rotary Club of Nagpur Vision (RCNV), in association with TOI, will be offering scholarships to Std X and XII students who, despite their underprivileged conditions, performed well in this year’s board exams. Around 160 students will receive financial assistance up to Rs3,000 and will be felicitated at special event scheduled for June 28. Under their Project Smiling Faces, RCNV hopes to make a difference to the lives of children who would have otherwise lost out on education. Rajiv Behal, president of RCNV, said their focus was on enabling such students to continue their education. “Scholarships are given to students who struggle to continue education due to financial constraints as their families are unable to pay expenses and basic needs. We want students to get educated so they are able to live their lives in a respectable way,” he said. RCNV hopes that with the financial assistance, the need to do odd jobs will not be there. Ajay Uplanchiwar, director of Project Smiling Faces, said, “The aim of the project is to provide scholarship to the high school graduates so they can build a better future and not do odd jobs. We have been doing this for the last two years to recognize underprivileged children and give them a better future.” Since these youngsters are unable to fend for themselves, RCNV believes it is important to lend them a helping hand. Nilanjan Bhowmick, chairperson, Project Smiling Faces, said, “The underprivileged children lack the support system that others have. We need to help them achieve their goals and that is what RCNV is trying to do.” RCNV has appealed to the public to inform them about underprivileged kids who deserve this scholarship. Information is to be shared with Bhowmick on Ph 9657552244 and/or at nilanjanbhowmick@gmail.com. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

CBSE-state board confrontation looms lar.description: NAGPUR: The Centralized Admission Process (CAP) for Std XI is yet to begin even though SSC results were declared on June 8. The hold-up at state level is because of growing concerns that the state board students will lose out on seats in good colleges because their CBSE counterparts have scored ‘high marks’ in the board exams. The state education officials have been brainstorming about various options to solve the problem, but so far nothing concrete has been done. Options such as considering only CBSE theory marks and increasing seats for 2019-20 academic session only are being discussed by officials. Academicians feel that this is an unnecessary controversy which is only hurting students. Reena Dargan, principal of Ira International School, said, “First of all there is an assumption that CBSE schools have marked the papers leniently, which is incorrect. Everything is done as per the model answer paper. It’s natural for confrontations to happen between two boards but to drag matters into a public forum is not done.” Dilip Bose, general secretary of School Headmasters Charitable Association, said, “This delay is not only unwarranted but also detrimental for academic future of students. The delay in admission process means delay in wrapping it up. Then automatically, the classes will start late and we will struggle to finish the course on time. And if poor results come then who will be blamed?”. Another senior state board school principal agreed that the issue was being blown out of proportion. “We had about 15,000-plus seats going vacant in Nagpur last year in Std XI, so why should there be such a hue and cry. There are ample seats available across all streams. There is no logical reason for people to stop the admission process,” she said. In Nagpur, science students usually go by whatever their coaching classes say and take admission there. Even otherwise, in the city, the craze for specific college does not exist. Obscure junior colleges in city are known to have more than double the enrolment of old and ‘branded’ colleges, simply because of their tie-up with coaching classes. In this scenario, the delay of admission process in Nagpur does not seem logical. An education department employee, who did not wish to be identified, said, “Since we are connected to the same admission software, the rules will have to be the same as well.” If at all the state education officials decide to not consider CBSE’s internal marks for Std XI admissions, then it will be the second major showdown between the two boards. The first was in 2011 when CBSE students who had appeared for the school-based exam in Std X were denied admission in Std XI of the state board junior colleges. At that time, the state board had raised questions about the credibility of school-based exam in which 100% marks were internally evaluated. The controversy ended only after a lobby group from Nagpur, that included parents, a cabinet minister and schools owners sorted out the issue with the then school education minister Rajendra Darda. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Panel may propose to turn Aapli Bus flee.description: NAGPUR: BJP corporator and transport committee chairman Bunty Kukde will present NMC’s transport department’s budget before the standing committee meeting on Tuesday and he may propose to convert all diesel run Aapli Bus into CNG. Kukde will revise the budget of transport manager Shivajirao Jagtap who had presented the department’s budget in March this year by projecting a revenue of Rs281.99 crore in the new financial year while the expenditure had been pegged at 281.86 crore. During 2018-2019, the NMC had suffered a loss of Rs94.17 crore for operating Aapli Bus and generated revenue of Rs60.56 crore from the sale of tickets while the total expenditure in 2018-19 was Rs154.73 crore. Kukde will make some changes and he may propose to convert all NMC run-Aapli Bus through three red bus operators into CNG and electric. The tax department will also submit proposals to transfer ownership titles of 14 property owners who had become defaulters. The accounts and finance department will submit a proposal for the panel’s nod for annual accounts for the year 2016-17 and 2017-18. To combat manpower crunch, the fire and emergency services department has submitted a proposal to appoint three retired drivers and 14 retired firemen on contract basis for 11 months. Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ushoshi Sengupta.description: KOLKATA: A gang of 10 bikers chased around Kolkata-based model Ushoshi Sengupta’s app cab through the streets of south Kolkata and harassed her — not once but twice — late on Monday night. The last round of harassment occurred after cops at a police station “refused to register her complaint” but, instead, referred her to the “right police station”.   Cops from Bhowanipore arrived around 10-15 minutes later. It was past midnight by then and Sengupta decided to pursue the case on Tuesday morning and requested the cabby to drop her colleague and her off at their homes. But the nightmare was far from being over. “The boys had followed us till my colleague’s house and, right when we were dropping him at Lake Gardens, six of them on three bikes came and stopped the car. They pelted stones, smashing the window. They then dragged me out and tried to break my phone to delete the video. Luckily, local people heard my cries for help and came out. The boys then fled,” Sengupta recalled.   She then called her father and sister; her own residence was just a lane away. They called cops, who came and asked her to file an FIR at the Charu Market police station. It was 1.30 a.m. when she reached there but, instead of taking down her complaint, the cops there directed her to Bhowanipore police station where the first assault had occured. “I just gave up and started shouting at this point. There was no female police officer. The officer there finally took down my complaint after asking a lot of questions but refused to take the cabby’s complaint, stating that two FIR could not be taken for the same incident,” she said. Frustrated and hapless, she returned home. It was at 2.30 p.m. on Tuesday that she posted the entire ordeal on Facebook along with a 20-second video clip. An additional CP later called Sengupta and assured her of strong action against not just the accused but an inquiry into police refusal to take her complaint citing jurisdiction issues. “The probe has just begun and we have identified all the culprits. More arrests are likely and we will probe whether there was lack of adequate response from cops,” said a Lalbazar official. The arrested were identified as Sheikh Rahit, Fardeen Khan, Sheikh Shabir Ali, Sheikh Gani, Sheikh Imran Ali, Sheikh Wasim and Atif Khan alias Md Samsad. A preliminary inquiry revealed the cab had accidentally brushed against the bike, causing the riders to lose balance. One of the bikes’ rear view mirrors broke and the youths accosted cabby Tarak Debnath to demand compensation. At least two more bikes and an auto carrying more people landed there, leading to the sequence of events ending with the assault at Lake Gardens, officials said. In Video:Kolkata: Former Miss India Ushoshi Sengupta harassed, 7 arrestedDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

300% rise in applications for board answ.description: NAGPUR: The Nagpur and Amravati divisional boards saw an unprecedented rush of students applying for photocopies of their HSC and SSC answersheets, which was a result of speculations that the evaluation has been very ‘strict’. Nagpur office specifically saw a 300% increase in the number of applications received for photocopies, which is the first step before students can apply for revaluation. The last date for applying for a photocopy ended on Monday. In Nagpur, over 5,000 students applied for photocopies of HSC while over 1,000 applied for SSC. In Amravati, over 1,700 HSC students applied for photocopies while only 1,000 did so for SSC. A senior board official said, “This time the rush for applications at Nagpur was extremely high. It was definitely more than three times of what we witnessed last year.” TOI was the first to report about huge rush across the state for paper valuation as many science students saw their scores being extremely low in one of the core subjects. The Vidarbha Junior College Teachers Association had issued a statement at that time saying their members have not made any mistake in evaluation, and the marks are just a reflection of how students performed on a particular day. With every subject’s photocopy costing Rs400, the two boards in Vidarbha have raked in a minimum of Rs50 lakh in application fee. Madhusudhan Mude, president of Headmasters Association (HA) said the fee was too high and should have been brought down. “Majority of the students apply for at least two subjects, some even go for three. This means that the board offices could have earned more Rs1 crore also. I think there is no reason for such a high application fee to be charged as most of the students in state board are not very economically strong so there is absolutely need for the board to be charging such an high amount,” said Mude. Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

With SEBC, EWS, quota now 81% for NU\u20.description: Nagpur: The Nagpur University (NU) on Saturday announced the much-delayed three-phase online centralized admission process (CAP) for postgraduate courses with 81% reservation under various categories, including the newly-introduced state’s Socially and Educationally Backward Class (SEBC) and Centre’s Economic Weaker Section (EWS), for students. While 50% seats were already reserved under different categories, the introduction of 16% SEBC, 10% EWS and 5% has increased the total quota further. These students would also be allowed to apply under the remaining 19% seats in the open category. The staggering quota percentage may not have an impact on admissions to humanities and commerce faculty courses but it can greatly impact the prospects for open category in the science stream. During the 2018-19 academic session, MSc courses had received an overwhelming response with 3,764 applying for 1,966 seats while MA courses had got only 3,704 applications against intake of 13,016. The vacant seats under a particular quota would be transferred to another reserved category. The online CAP is applicable to all the 38 NU departments, and over 100 affiliated colleges for non-professional courses where admissions are not done by any other government agency. The number of seats in science faculty are likely to be same while humanities and commerce may see a drop due of ban on admission to 80 colleges. As of now, admissions to seven PG courses have opened while rest would be added when final-year UG results are declared. The NU had held back the announcement for the last 15 days mainly due to lack of guidelines on seat allocation under the new quotas from the government which has found itself in a tight spot over PG medical and dental admissions. While students were demanding release of the CAP schedule in June first week to ensure academic schedule compliance, colleges apprehended loss of admissions due to the delay. In phase-I, admissions to just seven courses have been announced. These are the same courses which were chosen for the pilot CAP last year when the process had kicked off in May last week itself. Last year, the CAP had begun on June 1 but dragged on till late September, just 15 days before the first semester exams, because of several anomalies, backlog students qualifying at the eleventh hour and colleges getting late permissions to admit students. The NU has started a separate portal for these admissions and students’ facilitation centres would be opened at several colleges besides at NU’s Amravati Road campus. The NU has already uploaded free of cost brochure carrying all the details of CAP process, intake capacity and course fee. There would be two CAP rounds on merit basis followed by third, if needed, for management seats. But only students who have registered for the first two rounds would be allowed to participate in CAP III. PG ADMISSION SCHEDULE Courses available in CAP Phase-I · Master of Law (LLM) · Master of Commerce (M Com) · Master of Commerce Professional (MCom Professional) · Master of Science (MSc Forensic Science) · Master of Cosmetic Technology (MCT) · Master of Fine Arts (MFA) · Master of Hospitality Management (M Hosp) Timetable for Admissions June 15 to 22 | Online form filling and submission at facilitation centres June 24 | Display of provisional merit list June 28 | Display of final merit list June 28-30 | Online submission of option form for round 1 July 1| Display of allotted seats July 6-8 | Online form filling for round 2 July 14 | Display of vacancy list for round 2 July 16 | Admission of round 3 by counselling Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

State CET cell blunder: SSC and HSC colu.description: NAGPUR: Software blunders in the online admission portal being handled by the state CET cell for professional undergraduate courses led to major chaos among parents and last minute salvage operation by the authorities. One of the biggest bloopers was the interchanging of SSC and HSC marks column in the portal which meant science stream students could not enter correct information. The problems were rectified later in the evening. A parent, who did not wish to be identified, said, “In the HSC marks column, they asked us to enter marks for both maths and biology. Since both fields were mandatory, we were not able to proceed further. It is obvious that students who appear for maths in HSC will not be going for biology.” Another problem was faced while entering SSC marks because of a clause mentioned there. “On the screen, it was written that if you have not appeared for maths, science or english, then enter zero. But that is not possible since maths and science are compulsory subjects at SSC level. The only explanation is that the software is erroneously showing SSC fields on HSC page and vice versa,” the parent said. Students also had problems entering their NEET marks. One of the students said, “Entering the NEET scores basically allows me to be eligible for the 15% all India quota. But the portal was asking for marks scored in individual subjects, even though NEET authorities have only given us percentile. So, we are stuck and not able to proceed further.” A student who had been trying to apply for engineering colleges said that it had become difficult to get doubts clarified as well. “You try calling on their helplines and see how many times somebody actually picks up. It’s frustrating that they can’t do anything without creating a mess,” said the student. The CET cell authorities were well aware of the issues that their software is facing and had gone into the crisis-solving mode. Anand Rayate, head of the state CET cell, told TOI that all these issues were being discussed in his ‘war room’. “We are working on the problems and the HSC/SSC page issue will be sorted very soon. Every other hitch that is being noticed will also be rectified so that students do not suffer,” said Rayate. Many academicians said that the state CET cell is not able to handle the workload well. A senior academician said, “This is the first time that they are handling the entire process and probably were not ready to take up such a large scale assignment. The earlier authority, DTE, had been doing it for quite some time and had learnt from past errors and had a well-oiled machine in place. But not to be unfair to the CET cell, I believe these are just teething troubles.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Green Card.description: NEW DELHI: In an attempt to strike a balance between those standing in queue for decades for employment-based green cards (owing to the per country caps) and the need to protect American workers, a bill - 'The Fairness for High Skilled Immigrants Act (S.386)', has been recently amended by Republican Senator Mike Lee. The amendments are being seen as a bid to facilitate its passage. To provide more protection to American workers, it requires that the employer sponsoring H-1B workers must disclose online (for at least 30 days) various details of the job on offer, such as occupation or job position, education and experience requirements, location and also how to apply for this job. A filing fee is also sought to be introduced forLabour Condition Applications(LCA), which is an attestation-based requirement that has to be met by sponsoring employers prior to filing of H-1B visa applications. This bill was originally introduced in the US Senate on February 7. It sought to remove the per country cap on employment-based green cards and shorten the wait time for the vast majority of applications in the backlog. US issues 1.40 lakh employment-based green cards annually. Substantial increase in denial of H-1B petitions of Indians: ReportHowever, not more than 7% can go to nationals of any one country. With a high influx of the Indian diaspora in the US, it has resulted in a heavy backlog, with those in the EB-2 category (having advanced degrees) having to face a wait time of 151 years. "Over the last decade, various bills to remove this per country cap, have failed to become law. S. 386 has been rescued from the fate of its predecessors through appeasement, specifically, by agreeing to amendments that would allow further restrictions on merit-based non-immigrant visas, particularly with regards to the H-1B programme. However, it is interesting to note that many of these so-called 'new' restrictions already exist in one form or another," Florida based immigration attorney, Ashwin Sharma, told TOI. For instance, even currently,   H-1B sponsoring employers have to certify   that they are not favouring immigrant workers over American workers. They have to indicate how they calculated the prevailing wages they are offering to H-1B workers (but these records are to be made available only on specific request of the concerned authorities), explained Sharma. While the bill would alleviate the green card backlog and significantly benefit India, followed by China, it also seeks to ensure that the green card for others is not delayed beyond the time it would have otherwise taken, had this bill not been passed. Another similar bill HR 1044, introduced by the Democrats is pending in the US House. 'Immigration Voice', a US based non-profit which is engaged in alleviating problems faced by legal highly-skilled immigrants, in its social media post on June 17, said that it has reached a deal with Senator Lee and the amendments will enable the bill to pass. "We have a deal to break the deadlock in the Senate!," it posted on Twitter. A note, issued by it analysing the various facets of S.386 including the amendments, states that the bill allows investigations against H-1B frauds to be based on anonymous complaints, eliminates arbitrary deadlines on investigations and permits investigations for general non-compliance with LCA requirements, as opposed to simply for a wilful violation. It seeks to increase the penalties for LCA violations that have remained unchanged since 1990. Whistle-blower protection, which is already available, is also incorporated in the amendment. The fee proposed for LCA documentation will be used to fund the department of labour's (DOL's) administrative and investigative activities associated with H-1B programme. A few amendments in the bill, such as the 30 day internet posting requirement, could cause delays and challenges, states an immigration expert. Another counsel says: "Companies can depute their employees on a B-1 (business) visa to the US for a temporary period. The requirement was that the salary should be borne by the non-US employer. While a B-1 was getting tougher to obtain, it was an option available. The bill seeks to eliminate the 'B-1 in lieu of H-1B' option. We need to see how this will pan out." In Video:Bill seeking to lift green card cap amended to protect US workersDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Business News.

\u2018India has just 2.4% of world\u2019.description: NAGPUR: India holds only 2.4% of total land surface but we host more than 18% of the world population. So think how little we have and how much more we have to share among each other, revealed DS Meshram, president of Institute of Town Planners of India (ITPI), New Delhi, here on Monday. Dr Meshram was speaking during the second edition of lecture series on ‘Manageable Cities and it’s Determinant Factors’. The event was held by ITPI, at its hall in Trimurti Nagar, on Monday. Dr Meshram further said, “In India the land to per person ratio is 0.0024 while in the world it is 0.011.” “The main issues for the marginality disturbance are land, human and financial capital. There is no land in urban areas to develop, neither people have the finances to support anymore development,” he said. He gave an example saying, “A frog cannot grow up to the size of an elephant neither an elephant can grow to infinity, in the same way there is a limit to the expansion of cities and towns.” Main speaker of the event and director of School of Planning and Architecture, Bhopal, N Sridharan spoke about the importance of planning and people marginalized based on income, caste, space, gender, age and asset. He told about how Modi government focused on most deprived sections and has transformed lives and livelihoods. Sridharan sounded optimistic by saying that by 2031 the population would go down by 6,000 in South India. He concluded his speech by saying, “We need more planners today, than ever before.” Sujit Rodge, chairman of ITPI, Nagpur, and Sarika Bhadure were also present. (Reporting by Himesh Pande) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Jaripatka residents gherao mayor over \u.description: NAGPUR: Residents of Snehdeep Nagar and peripheries of Hadasram Dharmshala, Indira Colony, Janata Hospital and many other localities under Prabhag number 1 (Jaripatka) are not getting regular tap water. To bring this issue to the notice of the authorities, a residents led by former NCP corporator Vedprakash Arya and Congress workers on Monday gheroed mayor Nanda Jichkar in her office. Women residents demanded scrapping privatization of water supply system while alleging irregularities in tanker service. Even after booking tankers on time, water is supplied after a gap of four to five days, they claimed. Arya pointed out that in the last eight years water supply of Nagpur city has increased from 500 MLD to 740 MLD. “Still non-revenue water has not come down,” he claimed. Mayor Jichkar directed the water supply department to look into the matter. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Varsity brings in new engg syllabus over.description: NAGPUR: Sitting over it for over one and half years, the Nagpur University (NU) has suddenly decided to implement the model All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) curriculum from this academic year after a mere two-hours discussion over lunch. Questions have been raised over NU’s move since none of the stakeholders was informed about it even as the new academic year is set to start in a couple of weeks. While concerns have been raised over damage a hurriedly prepared syllabus may leave on NU’s engineering education, this year’s aspirants would be at a loss of not knowing the entire four-year syllabus. Last week, the proposal was tabled before the Board of Studies (BoS) to clear the move when one of the members reflagged it and demanded an elaborate deliberation. So far, only the first-year syllabus has been formulated. Mahendra Chaudhary, who is a BoS Applied Science and Humanities as well as Senate member, was shocked to know about the proposal. He refused to sign the proposal until the BoS allowed discussion on the new syllabus. “I wrote to the vice chancellor expressing my concerns. We need to think about students from the region. The AICTE curriculum is meant for IIT-level students while our colleges have 45 percenters enrolled with them. Ideally, there should be been discussion spread over months. But, now at least faculty members need to be informed through some initiative,” Chaudhary said. On his demand, the NU has agreed to organize workshops, which too has been alleged as a futile exercise. “The discussion is on the proposed syllabus which means the already decided one would be implemented. Only a handful of engineering faculty members were invited to formulate this new syllabus which is not in accordance with AICTE norms,” some teachers told TOI. The discussions to be held at different colleges from Monday have been dubbed as eyewash since it would deliberate on the syllabus for just over two hours. As per the workshop schedule, the discussion would taken up after lunch between 2.30pm and 4.30pm. Those opposed to NU’s abrupt move wanted involvement of all stakeholders since the start. Stakeholders involve parents, students’ representatives, industry professionals, academicians apart from university officials and members. Surprisingly, the NU has kept the entire affair under wraps as it never bothered to invite suggestions and objections from stakeholders in the last one and half years. The AICTE had introduced the model curriculum in January 2018. The NU also never uploaded a single document or meeting notice on its website about the move. University’s Vice chancellor SP Kane didn’t respond to TOI’s calls and SMS. The new curriculum envisages more weightage to region specific and skill-based learning. Over 60 credits too have been cut to encourage industry internships. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Go for physiotherapy, fix your career im.description: Physiotherapy enhances quality of life through examinations and diagnosis. This primary care treatment also includes research and consultation A flexible body always contributes to leading a healthy life. Even the slightest ache in any single bone leads to surgery if the path has been wavered with ignorance. Physiotherapy is a profession which helps in curing every little bodily disturbance with ease and relaxation. A time-to-time check-up and a regular five-minute exercise is all what a physiotherapist asks for. Physiotherapy enhances quality of life through examinations and diagnosis. This primary care treatment also includes research, consultation and administration professions. Sports physiotherapist Dr Sumit Meshram said, “Physiotherapy is an evolving field in today’s generation. This field of work is related to physical mobility of a person. Knowledge on how to deal with minor injuries is taught in physiotherapy. No sports player can function without regular exercise and physiotherapy.” “This field also helps in preventing major traumas that often happen due to ignorance of short-term pains. An alternative to medicines is physiotherapy. This exercise-related treatment is quite helpful in avoiding medicinal indulgence,” he said. Physiotherapy does not only mean exercises; there are a variety of subjects and branches offered. Dr. Bhagyashri Hajare, a neuro development therapist, said, “This field is one of the leading professions in India and abroad. Almost everyone today is a fitness lover and requires proper diet, along with a proper body. To maintain a healthy life, everyone invests in a physiotherapist without thinking twice.” “It includes many branches of which the most trending are paediatric neuro, adult neuro, physiotherapist in orthopaedics, community-based rehabilitations, cardio physiotherapist, sports physiotherapist and so on. Along with the degree, there are separate certification courses which help in securing a heavily paid job in different countries. Being a physiotherapist requires both knowledge of the study as well as how to gain a patient’s everlasting trust,” she said. Apart from physiotherapy, another interesting branch called ‘occupational therapy’ has come into consideration where, along with physiotherapy, consultations and psychiatry are looked upon excessively. But there are only a limited number of colleges in the country teaching this course. Dr Sana Khan, an occupational therapist, said, “Occupational therapy is an emerging theme since it deals with mental health, along with physique. An occupational therapist deals with quality of life of a patient as one cannot achieve full treatment until done with activities of daily living. This profession gives an adaption to life. An occupational therapist can work all over the world and has a good pay scale. This field is exceptionally good with rehabilitations, which most people are unaware of.” Why opt for the subjectHelp those who are in pain Lucrative and rewarding Decent salary Safe and trusted profession Expert View | Dr Ashish AgrawalProfession now evolving at great speedPhysiotherapy is a branch of medical studies that involves providing remedies to any part of the body that has discomfort. Physiotherapy promotes mobility. This physical therapy takes care of curing minor bone fractures or disorders. Everybody today survives with the help of a physiotherapists who recommend regular exercises. This leading profession is now evolving at great speed every day. Developments and supreme technologies have made a huge impact on this study. Everyday, an entirely new research comes into consideration which has improved the quality of medical sciences on the whole. Physiotherapy is a really good choice for even those who have an interest in the field of sports as a sportsman compulsorily needs a physiotherapist on a daily basis. Sports physiotherapy is one such branch which gives physiotherapist an opportunity to deal with a sportsperson on and off the field. Ensuring “return to play” is one of the biggest challenges for a sports physiotherapist, because every sportsman wants to play as early as possible. It’s quite satisfying for a physiotherapist to make the sportsman play after an injury and perform well. Advancements and progress never have a full stop in this fast, developing world. Everyday, people are being introduced to something they never saw coming. Physiotherapy nowadays offers different post graduate courses in the form of sports, manual, geriatric, paediatric, neuroscience, musculoskeletal, cardio-respiratory, hand, women’s health etc. Being a physiotherapist is a great choice since it gives a better view of looking over at life and health. (Dr Agrawal is a physiotherapist and Level 1 BCCI physio) List of collegesDatta Meghe College of Physiotherapy Courses offered: BPTh (Bachelor of Physiotherapy) Duration: 4 years + 6 months internship Admission procedure: Candidates are required to appear for an entrance test i.e. National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) Source: College website Niharikaa College of Physiotherapy Courses Offered: BPTh Duration: 4 years + 6 months internship Admission procedure: Candidates are required to appear for NEET Source: Dr Sujit Nath Banerjee, secretary of the college Government Medical College, Nagpur Courses Offered: BPTh Duration: 4 years + 6 months internship Admission procedure: NEET Source: College website This list is not exhaustive and should not be considered as the endorsement of the institute. Students are advised to check with relevant education authorities before taking admission PROFESSIONALS SPEAKPhysiotherapy is a medical field where we deal with pain in the body, be it of muscles or bones. It is very hard and laborious field. But it is always a pleasure to be rewarded with elation when people get cured, especially if they are children or senior citizens Dr Maneesha Deshpande Physiotherapy is not what it was once. In fact, the industry has grown quite a lot and awareness about it is increasing too. The study is hard but I feel that more and more youths should participate in it and opt for it as their career Dr Neena Sahu From my experience in the past 15 years, I feel people are now more conscious about what physiotherapy is and what it can do. It is about hard work and patience. No one has succeeded in this field by hurrying their way Dr Vaishali Kalbande To all the aspirants of physiotherapy, I would like to suggest that it is not easy to make it big in this industry without patience and labour. I advise you to do your work with all honesty and not let your patients return disappointed Dr Naveen Bhagat Physiotherapy is a difficult career to pursue. However, health is the harmony of body and mind and a physiotherapist can really help you in bringing peace in both. As a physiotherapist, I will always recommend this branch of medical science Dr Vikas Prem Mahobiya (Compiled by Manshika Vaikkath, Anchal Bhatia, Shristi Sankrit & Amrit Parida) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. GRIHA council to rate 525 government bui.description: Nagpur: GRIHA Council, a green building rating body in India, signed six memoranda of understanding (MoU) with the Maharashtra government, regional chief engineers, and public works department to initiate the second phase of the PWD-GRIHA green building initiative in the state. This would include rating of 525 existing government buildings on the parameters of GRIHA existing building rating system, along with training and capacity building of PWD officials. Earlier, 300 existing government buildings were rated in the first phase of the initiative. Maharashtra is the first state in India to lead the initiative of transforming its existing and to-be built infrastructure at a large scale by committing upcoming structures to green rating system, training its officials to evaluate building performance, and offering incentives to builders for adopting green practices, said a GRIHA press release. GRIHA also has a cell in PWD that helps to build capacity of officials as green building evaluators, thus accelerating the process of greening urban spaces. The MoU was signed at Nagpur in the presence of minister of road transport and highways Nitin Gadkari. The minister also launched policy guidelines to integrate sustainable practices while operating buildings to ensure their sustainability by enhancing resource efficiency. Gadkari said, “Buildings account for a substantial part of energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions. Green buildings result in longevity and improve productivity.” GRIHA is an independent, not-for-profit society jointly set up by The Energy Resources Institute (TERI) and ministry of new and renewable energy (MNRE). Couple robbed at knifepoint.description: NAGPUR: Four unidentified youngsters aged between 20 and 22 years robbed a couple at knifepoint near Ambazari T-point on Monday, fleeing with valuables worth Rs17,000, including cash Rs5,000. The robbers also decamped with a mobile phone from the couple. Rakesh Sasane, 22, and his woman friend were enjoying a ride around Ambazari Lake on their two-wheeler when they were intercepted near the T-point by the armed youngsters. After compelling the couple to part with their valuables, the youngsters fled the spot. Sasane, working as an attorney, approached Ambazari police station and registered a complaint of robbery. Traffic cop held with liquor, dismissed.description: NAGPUR: Traffic constable Sachin Hande, attached to Sitabuldi division, was dismissed from service by the Joint commissioner of police Ravindra Kadam on Tuesday. He was earlier caught, along with one Pranav Mhaisekar, by Chandrapur police near Nanduri toll naka on June 9 while ferrying foreign liquors in a car in the dry district. Hande and Mhaisekar were arrested by Warora police of Chandrapur district after seizing two cartons of liquor in their car. The car was driven by Mhaisekar. Hande, who was in uniform despite being a holiday, had tried to mislead the cops. Warora police was also granted two days of custody remand by the court for detailed investigation. It’s learnt that the car was in the name of Mhaisekar’s mother who is a medical practitioner too. City police top brass, after receiving the official reports from their Chandrapur counterparts, decided to invoke the powers granted to competent authority under article 311 (2) (B) of the Indian constitution to remove Hande from service for maligning the image of the department. The city police also cited the nexus of Hande with criminals and racketeers as the other reason for his dismissal. Another ground, proposed to dismiss Hande, was that he may influence, threaten and intimidate the witnesses if any inquiry is instituted against him. Chainsukh Sancheti takes over as VDB cha.description: NAGPUR: Chainsukh Sancheti, a five-term MLA of the Bharatiya Janata Party from Malkapur constituency in Buldhana district has finally assumed the charge of chairman of the Vidarbha Development Board (VDB). His appointment was initially announced in June last year. One of the senior-most BJP MLAs, he has been getting elected continuously since 1995 from Buldhana district. A very loyal worker of the party, his family has strong roots in the RSS. Sancheti till recently stayed away from power. He was appointed on June 11 last year as the development board chairman. But Sancheti was apparently not that keen on the post and instead sought a ministerial berth though the board chairman’s post has cabinet minister status. Now with his 5th term coming to an end in a few months, he accepted the post just after he could not make it to the cabinet in a reshuffle on Sunday by chief minister Devendra Fadnavis. On Monday, in the presence of VDB member Dr Kapil Chandrayan, board deputy director Prakash Dayre and staff he took charge and expressed his commitment to give a boost to the VDB work by pursuing pending issues with the governor who is the statutory head of the board. An MSc in chemistry, Sancheti also dabbled in the construction business before starting his political career as municipal council member and then MLA for five terms from Malkapur. In college days he was a keen wrestler. He is the uncle of influential ex-MP Ajay Sancheti. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

European tech to make Nagpur-Badnera tra.description: NAGPUR: The ‘collision-free’ Modern Train Control System (MTCS) level II is set to be implemented within two years on the 175km Nagpur-Badnera section, making it one of the safest in the country. The Rs475 crore project is a form of European Train Control System (ETCS), which is a globally recognized system of upgraded signalling and communication to improve safety, speed and punctuality. The modernization project for signalling system, which includes the Automatic Train Protection System with Long Term Evolution (LTE)-based Mobile Train Radio Communication Technology (MTRC) along with electronic interlocking, is part of the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) signed by Indian Railways with RailTel Enterprises Limited (REL) this week. Apart from Nagpur-Badnera section in Central Railway, the project would be implemented on other stretches too like Renigunta-Yerraguntla (South Central Railway), Vizianagaram-Palasa (East Coast Railway) and Jhansi-Bina section (North Central Railway). All these are among the busiest routes in the nationwide railway networks. The project would be implemented on almost 500 locomotives on the earmarked routes. The Railway Board is learnt to have taken up the Rs1,609 crore project to implement the globally acknowledged Indian version of the ETCS (MTCS) to raise the standard of safety of passengers, and increase line capacity with modern signalling and communication system to match international standards. Maninder Singh Uppal, officiating Divisional Railway Manager (DRM), Central Railways, said the latest system is the upgraded version of the already existing one, which would remove any possibility of collision. “Safety, punctuality and speed would be improved. The train would automatically stop if it crosses a red signal and it would also halt in case there is a possibility of head-on or side-on collisions,” said Uppal. “If the manual application fails, the brake would be immediately applied after signal passing and danger. The speed of the train would also be reduced automatically depending upon the allowed sectional speed,” he said. Uppal said the speed and punctuality would both be improved by 20-30%. “The railway traffic movement in the highly congested Nagpur-Badnera section would witness a considerable improvement,” said the senior railway official. Uppal said the speciality of ETCS level-II is that it would ensure continuous monitoring of the train speed vis-à-vis requirements of stoppage and control based on the status of the signal. “The system works and is based on radio communication system between the loco pilots, guards, base stations and from there to the control centre, with the help of optical fibre cable. Any official within a section operating the train would be reachable through communication set,” he said. Uppal also said the budget (Rs475 cr) has already been vetted, sanctioned and sent to REL by the zonal railway authorities. “The project would mostly involve experts from international stakeholders,” he said. Railway Board authorities have said that speedy execution of the project is expected as REL is already engaged in collecting, collating and analysing inputs and feedbacks from industry representatives on various aspects of technology, interfaces, compatibility and inter-operability of various sub-systems. VTA for Jan-Dec fin year in Budget.description: NAGPUR: Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman had asked inputs from citizens on the Union Budget 2019-20 with a view to make the Budget making exercise more participative and inclusive. Accordingly Vidarbha Taxpayers Association (VTA) called a general body meeting which was presided by JP Sharma to discuss and send suggestions to the finance ministry. President of VTA JP Sharma suggested that it is high time that central government brings in Direct Tax Code (DTC), wherein the accounting year should be rescheduled to January to December so that we match the universal pattern of accounting. Secretary Tejinder Singh Renu submitted that VTA has been constantly writing to finance ministry that threshold limit of direct tax should be raised from existing Rs2.5 lakh to Rs5 lakh in DTC; likewise the tax slabs should also be 10% for Rs5 lakh to Rs10 lakh salary, 20% for Rs10 lakh to Rs20 lakh and 30% above Rs20 lakh. More accountability on assessing officers should be introduced so that sense of responsibility is there on both the sides. Vice-president Shrawankumar Malu suggested that bank lending and its procedure has been too much rigid whereby even genuine borrowers, business houses and industries are facing tough times to manage financial deals. Hence it’s highly recommended that finance ministry relaxes banking procedure to its realistic position wherein financial institutions as well as business can grow steadily. Likewise more liberty should be given to bank heads in same city itself so that file data transfer and delay is eliminated. Industrialist Surendrakumar Jaiswal suggested that threshold limit of Micro Small and Medium Enterprise (MSME) should be increased from Rs10 crore to Rs50 crore. Furthermore definition of MSME of Centre and State varies which creates too many complex situations. Hence they should be common for factual growth of this sector. Saqib Parekh suggested that terminology of assessment year (AY) should be totally eliminated in DTC as this FY and AY creates too much of confusion for common man and with January to December financial year the year mention would also be single, which will bring much needed clarity. VTA members present in the meeting were treasurer Pawan Chopra, joint secretaries Hemant Trivedi and Amarjeet Singh Chawla, executive body members Ashvin Agrawal, CA Hemant Sarda, Govind Patel, Veeru Balani, Rahul Agrawal, Narendrapal Singh Osan, Pankaj Roshan, Harmanjeet Singh Baweja, Pratish Gujrathi and others. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Jumping signal or using phone while driv.description: NAGPUR: If you thought you can jump a traffic signal or use mobile phone while driving and get away by paying a fine, you are in for a shock. Nagpur traffic police are now suspending driving licences of such offenders. In the five months this year, the traffic police have asked regional transport office (RTO) to suspend driving licences of 2,425 violators. These are for violations like over speeding, using mobile phones, carrying passengers in goods vehicles, signal jumping, drunken drive and unruly behaviour by autorickshaw drivers. Traffic police seized the licences and sent them to RTO for suspension between January 1 and May 31, 2019. In this period traffic police booked 34,625 drivers under these offences. So they have recommended suspension of licences for 7% drivers only. Traffic Police initially only seized licences of repeat offenders but now even first-time offenders will have their licences taken away for at least three months. The traffic police term this change a “silent revolution”. “Given that around 20 lakh vehicles ply on Nagpur’s roads, we have kept one in 10 drivers away from the wheels for at least three months,” a senior officer from the traffic branch said. According to the officer, Traffic Police had been recommending the cancellation of driving licences for a long time as per Motor Vehicles Act Sections 19 and 21, but it was nowhere close to the scale it is today. “We were cautious in implementing the stringent rule. We did it only in case of repeat offenders,” the officer claimed. The officer also pointed out that even a Supreme Court-appointed committee had issued directions to seize driving licences for five grave traffic violations speeding, signal jumping, drunk driving, use of mobile phones while driving and carrying passengers in goods vehicles. According to data from traffic branch, driving licences of 1,494 people were suspended for driving under the influence of liquor, while licences of 397 have been suspended for jumping signals and 311 for using mobile phones while driving. Traffic experts called it a welcome step. They admitted lack of enforcement in city had increased violations manifold. Suspending licence was far more stringent move than simply paying a few hundred rupees and getting away, experts added. They pointed the traffic police needed to make people aware of their new stance. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Exceptional journey of Shivaji Maharaj\u.description: NAGPUR: An exceptional journey through the forts of Chhatrapati Shivaji was expressed in an audio-video form in an event titled ‘Sahyadritil Saat Ratne’ at Scientific Society Hall, Laxmi Nagar, on Sunday. The event was organized to mark the 345th anniversary of Shivaji Maharaj’s coronation. Vivek Ranade and Shivani Dani were the chief guests of the programme which was conceptualized by Praful Mategaonkar who spoke about all the forts, starting with Shivneri. The 17th century Shivneri fort is the birthplace of Shivaji and is located in Junnar, 90km from Pune. At the centre there is a pond known as ‘Badami Talav’ while on the south there are statues of Jijabai and young Shivaji. There is ample water in the fort as there are two round-the-year springs called Ganges and Yamuna, said Mategaonkar. “Located in Pune district, the large Torna Fort, also known as Prachandagad, was the first fort won by Shivaji at the age of 16. It’s regarded as the first pillar of Maratha empire. It is the highest and most difficult fort to capture as it is equipped with ‘zunjar machi’ fortification,” he said. About Rajgad fort, he said that it was formerly known as Murumdev, and was the capital of Maratha empire for 26 years, before Shivaji shifted the capital to Raigad Fort. The most historic place inside the fort is Padmavati Mati. Sinhgadh, 35km southwest of Pune, gets natural protection due to the steep hills. Even British army found it hard to capture, he said. “The Battle of Sinhgadh was fought between Marathas, led by a fierce general Tanaji Malusare and the Mughals. Tanaji lost his life in battle but his troupe won the fort. On hearing about Tanaji’s death Shivaji said, ‘Gadh aala, pan Sinh gela’,” he said. Initially known as ‘Kondhana’, Sinhgadh fort has two gates — Kalyan Darwaza and Pune Darwaza. later Mahatma Gandhi and Bal Gangadhar Tilak had a historic meeting here. At 1,080 metres above sea level Pratapgadh, is famous for the battle between Shivaji and Afzal Khan. There is an Afzal tower which defends the approach towards the fort. Afzal Khan’s body is buried under the tower and his dargah is located nearby,” he said. About Sindhudurg fort, Mategaonkar said, “Located in Arabian Sea on the shore of Malvan town in Konkan region, Shivaji built the fort to counter the rising influence of foreign colonizers and negate the rise of Siddis of Janjira.” “Raigadh fort was the capital of Maratha empire. Shivaji had seized it from Raje Chandraraoji More in 1656. The fort has the Samadhi of Jijabai,” he said, adding, “In 1689, Zulfikhar Khan captured Raigad and later Aurangzeb renamed it as Islamgadh. Execution point ‘Takmak Tok’ can be seen clearly from the fort. (Reporting by Himesh Pande) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities.
