AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. MWRRA slams NMC for using dead stock fro.description: NAGPUR: The Maharashtra Water Resources Regulatory Authority (MWRRA) has reportedly slammed the Water Resources Department (WRD) and Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) for using dead stock of Totladoh reservoir. Advocate Ashish Jaiswal, former Shiv Sena MLA from Ramtek, had brought it to the notice of MWRRA that dead stock is being used without permission since last one month. In a big revelation, Jaiswal said the state government has not issued any written permission to use the dead stock. Jaiswal has filed a contempt petition against WRD, NMC, collector, and two more respondents with MWRRA. A five-member bench of MWRRA chaired by KP Bakshi held a hearing on the petition on Tuesday. In the petition, Jaiswal said using dead stock was a contempt of MWRRA order dated September 12, 2018. “WRD has even allowed NMC to use more water than allocated from Totladoh reservoir. NMC did nothing to bring down losses or develop its own water sources,” he said. Jaiswal told TOI, WRD and NMC committed a crime by using dead stock without permission. “WRD and NMC officials failed to show any permission to MWRRA. It has come at the cost of lakhs of farmers, people, cattle and wildlife. I pleaded for appropriate action against all concerned persons from the five respondent agencies,” he said. On May 14, mayor Nanda Jichkar had met CM Devendra Fadnavis and claimed to have received permission to utilize 30 MMC from dead stock. On the directives of MWRRA, WRD officials said NMC used 163 MMC as against allocation of 154 MMC as on Monday. “Total utilization of water for NMC will be around 170 MMC by June end,” they said. MWRRA reportedly came down heavily on WRD and NMC for using more water than allocated. Jaiswal added NMC misled MWRRA on the quantum of non-revenue water (NRW). “MWRRA asked NMC officials to inform it about current NRW. NMC officials said current NRW was 45%. Actually, NRW of NMC is much more than that. MWRRA passed strictures on NMC officials. NRW of NMC should have been 14% in current condition,” he said. Jaiswal also brought it to the notice of MWRRA that NMC has failed to bring down high consumption. He said NMC was drawing and supplying much more water than norms and requirement. In the petition, Jaiswal said the respondents did not comply with one of the directives of MWRRA. “NMC has not complied with direction passed by this authority by not carrying out the accrued assessment of groundwater potential with the help of Groundwater Survey and Development Agency, Pune, and Central Groundwater Board office at Nagpur. It has also not planned augmentation of water supply with groundwater, storm water as well as ponds/ reservoirs/ tanks available within Nagpur city area,” he said. Women SHGs to plant bamboo in Koradi pla.description: NAGPUR: Energy minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule has directed Mahagenco to make available land belonging to Koradi Thermal Power Station (KTPS) to women self help groups (SHGs) for bamboo plantation. Accordingly, 75 acre will be handed over on July 1. SR Gajalwar, superintending engineer (civil) of KTPS, said that each SHG would have 20 members. “We will hand over 5 acre to one SHG. As fifteen such groups have been selected, the total area to be brought under bamboo cultivation is 75 acre. This was meant for tree plantation. We are doing both afforestation as well as discharging our social responsibility,” he added. Mahagenco has roped in National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (Neeri) for technical consultation. “Neeri scientists will help the SHG members in planting bamboo and taking care of the plants for three years. After that the members will do the job themselves,” said Gajalwar. According to the official, the ownership of the plantation land will remain with Mahagenco. “We are handing it over to the women just for use. We will not charge any rent,” he said. Mahagenco is yet to decide whether it will keep a share of revenue generated from sale of bamboo. Replying to a query, Gajalwar said, “The SHGs were chosen by senior officials of KTPS.” Mahagenco has lot of open land in KTPS. A mini solar power plant has come up on ash bund of Chandrapur Super Thermal Power Station (CSTPS). However, there are no such plans in Koradi plant. Some of its land has been however, used for the fly-ash cluster. Hearing on Genco’s coal mine on 27thThe public hearing for the Gare Pelma coal mine of Mahagenco in Chhattisgarh will be held on June 27. The mine has been allocated to the generation company for meetings its future coal needs. Mahagenco has appointed Adani as its operator even though all the formalities are yet to be completed. The coal mine is facing strong opposition from locals, whose land is to be acquired. Mahagenco expects trouble from activists and police security has been sought. Earlier, coal ministry had allocated Macchakatta mine in Odisha to Mahagenco but it could not acquire land due to opposition from locals. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Singing show winner Sugandha is now an i.description: NAGPUR: Fourteen-year-old Sugandha Date, who recently clinched the top prize in a television reality show, is already an internet sensation with 14,000 followers. This was the second attempt by Sugandha on television, the earlier being one in 2013, when she was barely six and was among the top five finalists. Often compared to popular playback singer Shreya Ghoshal, Sugandha, who hails from Nagpur, won hearts especially with her rendition of songs like ‘Dhadak’, ‘Bhaire Naina’ and ‘Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam’. “Though she missed the trophy in 2013 this win has more than made up for it,” said her mother Amruta. Already in exam mode as she prepares for her Std X boards next year, Sugandha says she is not affected by the attention that comes her way through Instagram, where she 14,800 followers. The number of those viewing her videos of rehearsals and highlights of her performance rose to 35,000 after she won the trophy. “Instagram and Facebook help build an image beyond the show, but it only works if the talent is real,” Amruta said. Sugandha has at least five fan club pages on Instagram and Facebook. “But for now, she is only concentrating on her training with her guru Anand Sharma and her studies,” her mother said. Two murders, one murderous assault rock.description: NAGPUR: Two murders, and a murderous assault on a gangster, within 24 hours left the city cops in a tizzy on Sunday. Ganesh Tandulkar, an autorickshaw stand coordinator at Jhansi Rani Chowk, was allegedly hacked to death by a gang of fellow drivers on Saturday. The assailants were apparently enraged that he shielded a man they wanted to eliminate. The incident took place at Udibaba Chowk in MIDC. The MIDC police acted quickly in the Tandulkar murder case, arresting three assailants, Abhijeet Singh, Rakesh Kuryavanshi and Vicky Dabekar. Within hours, 22-year-old Gaurav Nagpure was stabbed to death by his rivals near a community toilet at Gangabai Ghat within the jurisdiction of Kotwali police station. Nagpure was attacked by his neighbours-turned-foe Tejas Bagde, Shoaeb Malik, Bobby Malik and others with sharp weapons over old rivalry. The injured Nagpure was rushed to hospital, where he was declared dead. Later in the evening, city and rural police set off on another chase when news of a murderous assault on gangster Viju Mohod started doing the rounds. Sources in the police said Mohod, who had kidnapped gangster Maroti Nuwa around two months ago, was apparently kidnapped from an eatery by close aides of another gangster, and thrashed up very badly. Staffers from Beltarodi, Nandanvan, and Sakkardara police stations of city, and Kuhi in rural, started a frenetic search to track down more information. Mohod had a dispute with another goon, identified as Amit Bilge, some days back, which was settled at marriage of one Bobby. Despite this, Mohod had been attacked by his rivals, and was in critical condition at hospital when reports last came in. The mastermind of the gang that attacked Mohod had been arrested by Pachpaoli police in an offence registered in 2017. In the same offence, the gangster had been freed even after being nabbed by crime branch, due to alleged political influence and support of a builder. In the Tandulkar murder, police said the assailants wanted to eliminate one Dinesh Pandey, also an autorickshaw driver, to teach him a lesson for confronting them earlier in the day. The three assailants are trying to establish their dominance at the autorickshaw stand, and Pandey had abused Singh in a lighter vein earlier in the day. It’s learnt that Tandulkar, whose cousin is posted at crime branch, too had a wordy duel with Vicky earlier in the day. Later, Pandey and Singh, who were once classmates, exchanged abuse at the autorickshaw stand at Rani Jhansi Chowk. They were separated by Tandulkar before he left to attend a family programme at Timki. In Tandulkar’s absence, Dabekar assaulted Pandey with a sword on his right shoulder. Pandey went to a hospital at Hingna and informed Tandulkar and another autorickshaw driver Chandrakant Bhagwat. Tandulkar and Bhagwat rushed to the hospital, picked up Pandey and dropped him home safely. Some time later, Tandulkar got a call on his cell phone from Kuryavanshi, who summoned him to Udibaba Chowk. Kuryavanshi and Dabekar wanted Tandulkar to call Pandey too at the spot. Tandulkar reached the spot but kept pleading with the assailants to forgive Pandey and forget the incident. As Kuryavanshi and Dabekar started getting aggressive, Tandulkar tried to sneak away in Bhagwat’s autorickshaw. But Kuryavanshi and Dabekar attacked Tandulkar, and while Singh thrashed Tandulkar, Dabekar assaulted him with a sword. MIDC police have registered an offence of murder against four persons, including the three already in custody. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

CISF officer, 5 family members die in ac.description: NAGPUR: CISF officer Pavan Negi, who was currently posted at Nagpur airport, and five family members lost their lives in a road accident at Tyuni in Dehradun district on Monday morning. The Alto car in which they were travelling from Banpur lost control and fell into a deep gorge killing all of them on the spot, local police said. The CISF officer along with his wife Rashmi, daughter Ishika, son Arav and two relatives, Murti Devi and Suman Devi, were found dead after the accident. Negi is survived by father and mother. The officer was posted at Nagpur airport and was on leave till June 22. Local police said all six passengers in the car were dead by the time rescuers reached them. All the bodies were recovered from the accident spot and sent them for post mortem. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

SC commission calls for report on boy su.description: WARDHA: The National Commission for Scheduled Castes (NSSC) has asked Wardha collector to file a report on the incident where an 8-year-old boy of Matang community suffered burns on being forced to sit on hot tiles as punishment after entering a temple at Arvi on Saturday. State women and child development minister Pankaja Munde also condemned the incident in Mumbai, and assured action against the accused. At Arvi, the Bhim Tiger Sena (BTS) demanded stringent action against the accused, and handed over a memorandum to district collector and sub-divisional office on Monday. The incident has been condemned by many organizations on social media too. Aryan Khadse, 8, a resident of Rani Laxmibai Ward of Arvi town, was accused of stealing some coins from a temple by accused Umesh alias Amol Dhore. The accused punished Aryan by forcing him to sit on hot tiles on Saturday afternoon, which caused serious burn injuries on his buttocks. Aryan is admitted at Arvi general hospital. On Monday, the state office of the NSSC, at Pune, wrote to the Wardha collector and superintendent of police, asking for a report on the incident. Attaching a printout of the story published in the TOI, the commission has asked for the factual details of the case. The BTS claimed in its memorandum that the incident happened out of hate ‘as victim entered temple’. The boy belongs to Matang community and was punished by Dhore, who belongs to OBC, they said. To stop such incidents in future, BTS demanded stringent action against accused Dhore. However, residents of Rani Laxmibai Ward reiterated on Monday, on condition of anonymity, that the children play in the temple yard every day, and no one has ever raised any objections. A resident said there is no caste discrimination, but the accused sells illicit liquor, and always creates trouble for children. He added, “I think the accused never dreamt of the consequences while punishing the child.” BTS district president Atul Diwe said the boy’s parents have objected to the horrible punishment. “If accused wanted to punish the child, he could have told the parents. He dared to do this because the boy belongs to lower class. Is it possible to do such a thing with any higher caste?” Diwe said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Experts brainstorm over clean air issue.description: NAGPUR: A seminar titled ‘Clearing the air in Nagpur: Strengthening actions through partnerships’, jointly organized by Clean Air Asia (CAA), Nagpur Municipal Corporation and Integrated Programme for Better Air Quality in Asia (IBAQ) provided a platform for a discussion on the Nagpur air action plan which has been recently approved by the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB).  The clean air action plan was prepared by Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) with support from National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (Neeri) and the NMC has taken up the lead in its implementation. The seminar was inaugurated by mayor Nanda Jichkar and municipal commissioner Abhijit Bangar. Setting the context for the seminar, India director of CAA Prarthana Borah said, “Since the clean air action plan has been approved by the CPCB, it is now time to deliberate over its implementation. The major problem lies in developing cities as there is increased constructional dust and emissions due to improper waste management deteriorate the air quality.” Borah said that the objective of organizing the session was to engage in a discussion regarding sustainable urban development and clean technology for clean air. Bangar emphasized on the need to take account of the vulnerable sections of the city as all localities are not affected equally. He added, “It is high time to start implementation of schemes for the improvement in air quality management. Through this event, an organized effort will be made to retain Nagpur's ‘Green city’ tag and move forward in the direction of maintaining good air quality for future generations.” In her address, Jichkar focused on the regulatory, policy and implementation tactics. She said, “Now that the Smart City project is in full-swing, the hazardous dust particles from constructional activities is a matter of seriousness. I hope, through citizen awareness and government partnership, we derive a concrete solution to mitigate pollution. Neeri has done a great job at creating a road map of the activities that need to be done. With the help of concerned officials and participation of leaders, we will implement strict rules to ensure everyone breathes fresh air.” Leena Buddhe, director at Centre for Sustainable Development (CFSD), urged NGOs to collaborate in implementation of the air action plan for leveraging wider change. AS Harinath, from World Bank, delved deeper into the aspects of implementation strategy of Nagpur air action plan. He said, “Having an action plan is the first step. Our commitment is to build on the government’s action plan. We then need implementation, investment and coordination between a number of agencies.” Representatives from local government, civil society, academia and technology providers engaged in an interactive session where they analysed their roles in the action plan and suggested proposals. \nTheatre connoisseurs enjoy the thrills.description: Enid Blyton’s classic English story— Five on a Treasure Island — from the famous five series was recently staged as a play in the city and it received great response from the theatre lovers. The play was directed by Vikash Khurana and had many thrilling and adventurous moments coupled with timely humour to keep the audience’s interest levels intact till the end. The young actors delighted the discerning audience with their performances and Khurana’s role as an antagonist was also appreciated by everyone. When we asked the director whether he had any inhibitions prior to the staging of the play, he said, “My biggest concern was to incorporate various scenes from the play on a small stage, but with proper planning, we managed to transcend the audience to Kirrin Island and the English countryside where the story is set.” We saw educationist Dr Dipti Christian and theatre person Aditya Bansod enjoying the theatrical treat with their friends.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. Govt fleecing farmers on crop insurance:.description: Nagpur: Former minister and Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Anil Deshmukh has accused the BJP-led state government of “looting” farmers in the name of providing crop insurance. In a press release issued on Monday, Deshmukh pointed out that crop insurance premiums are deducted from agriculture loans provided to farmers leaving the latter with no options but to pay up. “There was a severe drought last year. Farmers, including orange and sweet lime (Mausambi) orchard owners, lost their crop totally. But not one of them received any claim from the insurance companies. Yet, all nationalized banks have yet again been instructed to deduct crop insurance premium amounts from crop loan being disbursed to farmers,” he said. “So, who is benefiting from crop insurance plans?” asked Deshmukh . He alleged that private insurance companies who have mandate to run crop insurance schemes were the ones whose interests the government was protecting. “Citrus fruit orchards’ insurance claims and that of other kharif crops are handed by different private companies who fail to respond to claims filed by hapless farmers,” Deshmukh said. The NCP leader has represented the orange belt of Katol-Narkhed area since 1995 in the state legislature before he was defeated in 2014 by nephew Ashish Deshmukh, who contested against him riding on the Modi wave. “The government has not given a penny to farmers reeling under drought and crop losses. Farm loan waiver scheme of the BJP government is yet to reach even 20% of the beneficiaries because of slow roll out,” said Deshmukh, preparing pitch for state elections that are just three months away. Various hues of life depicted in 10 play.description: NAGPUR: Humour, satire and emotions which are inseparable part of life were on display during the ten plays presented in Sugar and Spice round IX, organized by Stagecraft at Matoshri Vimlatai Deshmukh Sabhagruh, Dhanwate National College, on Saturday. The event started with an emotional thought-provoking drama ‘Meri Dadi Kahan Hai’, directed by Anurima Chakraborty. The play is about a little girl Khushi Mohta who is in search of her grandmother (Jigyasa Bharti). In the process, the girl takes help from an autowala, rabbit, dog, tortoise, lion and bear. The actors were Samvardhan Khandelwal, Ismat Chimthanawala, Viraj Shah, Arundhati Jogdand, Rahul Bhojwani and Pratiksha Kaleshwarwar. The play was written by Padmashree Pande. ‘Happy Meal’, directed by Shivani Joshi and written by Shubhankar Mishra, was full of humour. A girl (Devika Patel) and her friend (Amol Wakhare) have a magic apple through which they can go to any place they wish to. But as an argument ensues, the girl throws away the apple. They are now stuck on a cold mountain peak, but then mother comes to their rescue and gives them a mango through which they can travel even to outer space. ‘Ek Chhoti Si Khwaish’, a satire on the condition of a student, written by Raunak Madne and directed by Anu Sabharwal, tells the story of a girl (Ruhi Khanuja) who is burdened by the wishes of her mother (Anurima Chakraborty) to become a doctor. But her teacher (Anurima Chakraborty) thinks she is dumb. The girl struggles to fulfil her mother’s dream but eventually ends up into depression. ‘Conversations’, directed by Rajat Rajani, dealt with standing up for self and being proud of who you are, was about a young woman (Ayushi Vairagade) opening up to her mother (Maria Shakir) and sister (Avni Jog) being gay. Harshit Verma played the role of a waiter. ‘Chidiya Udd’ was a satire on how today’s generation has lost childhood under the burden of tuition classes and extra-curricular activities. The play, written by Nitish Chandra, was directed by NV Sharma. The cast included Tahir Shibam, Swati Lohe, Riddhi Lohe and Huzefa Kotawala. Another satire, ‘Three Monkeys & A Like Button’ was based on how our life is being directed by a ‘like’ button of Facebook. The play was written by Jaya Girathe and directed by Maria Shakir. The cast included Shaima Patel, Neelam Singh and Manank Panchmatia. Emotional play ‘Remembering My Grandmother’ was written by Jaee Jog and directed by Neha Khanzode. The cast included Nivedita Jogdand, Shivani Joshi and Rahul Bhojwani. ‘Nowhere to Play’, written by Bianca Nazareth-Arya and directed by Sonal Bindra, was a satire on how children today do not have a place to play. The cast included Vardaan Anand, Parthiv Banerjee, Harsh Dayaramani and Anu Sabharwal. ‘Loose’ was about how if our parents become care free and never tell us to study and let us do as we wish. The play was written by Onkar Ghare and directed by Sanskruti Bajoria. Shika Kalra, Madhvi Ambhore and Kuldeep Lohe were the actors. Audience laughed heartily when ‘Andher Nagri Chopat Raja’, written by Shantanu Thengdi and directed by Taher Shibam, was staged. The cast included Samson Aiyub, Shlok Vij, Lalit Ghavghave, Ashwin Shukla, Namrata Shukla, Manank Panchmatia, Sana Thombre and Shubham Veergandham. Lalit. Ghavghave stole the show with his quick wit. (Reporting by Himesh Pande) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

GMCs at Amravati, Buldhana get in-princi.description: NAGPUR: Crunch in MBBS seats will ease to some extent as the central government has given in-principle approval to seven new Government Medical Colleges in state. These include two in Vidarbha at Amravati and Buldhana. Medical education minister of Maharashtra Girish Mahajan told TOI Ministry of health and family welfare had given an in-principle approval to state government’s proposal to upgrade seven district hospitals in state into medical colleges. “I had a very fruitful meeting with Union health minister Dr Harsh Vardhan last week. He has sanctioned many proposals given by the state’s health education department. These include seven GMCs and several research institutes. This will bring in 3,670 more MBBS seats and nearly 800 PG seats in the state in the long run,” Mahajan said. The central government’s health ministry has a scheme to establish new medical colleges by upgrading district or referral hospitals. As part of this, it has been proposed to convert 75 district hospitals into medical colleges to boost availability of human resource for health sector. Maharashtra has proactively submitted proposals for seven district hospitals. When these hospitals become medical colleges, the directorate of medical education (DMER) will run them instead of directorate of health services (DHS). This is still a first step. It takes time to establish a medical college even if a general hospital has many basic facilities. According to a senior official of DMER, the state as well as the Centre were keen to increase MBBS and MD seats as it was necessary for the implementation of EWS reservation. “The in-principle approval is a major step. These seven new GMCs will be functional in next two years,” the official claimed. At present, there are 41 medical colleges in State. They are affiliated to Maharashtra University of Health Sciences (MUHS). In Vidarbha, there are two GMCs in Nagpur, and one each in Chandrapur, Yavatmal, Akola, and Gondia. Major boost to medical education New medical colleges: District hospitals in seven districts — Buldhana, Amravati, Satara, Parbhani, Nandurbar, Nashik and Sindhudurg will become medical colleges Long pending Institutes: Pending work of Regional Institute of Paramedical Science in Nagpur, Special paramedical centres in Pune and Miraj will be completed Research organization: Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH) in Nagpur will have a centre of excellence in Sickle Cells Hemoglobinopathy developed by ICMR Cancer care: As projects like National Cancer Grid, Virtual Tumour Board, Cancer Fellowship are to be implemented in state, a national cancer institute will be started in Jalgaon More MBBS Seats: Total 3,670 seats will be added to state’s quota. From these, 2020 could be used for implementation of EWS reservation and 1650 for implementation Maratha reservation Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. NMC to demolish 121 illegal religious st.description: Nagpur: The Nagpur Bench of Bombay High Court on Monday was informed by the civic authorities that 121 illegal religious structures within city limits will be demolished within one month. The bench comprising justices RK Deshpande and Vinay Joshi directed Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) commissioner to later file an affidavit stating that all 121 structures have been demolished. NMC will give 15-day notice to the parties affected, before the actual demolition takes place. Last year, the NMC took a count of total illegal religious structures within its jurisdiction and then segregated them into category A and B. Those in category B were the ones which could not be regularized and had to be demolished. A special committee heard objections and claims over the list and finally 1,084 structures were put in category A while 121 were put in category B. Advocate Firdos Mirza appeared for the petitioners while advocate Sudhir Puranik represented NMC. On September 19 last year, the HC had directed NMC to form a committee under the civic chief to prepare a revised list of illegal religious structures within city limits. It directed that structures that can be regularized should be included in category A, while those which cannot be regularized should be put in category B. \nGovernment Chitrakala Mahavidyalaya ho.description: There was a flurry of excitement among the students and teaching staff of Government Chitrakala Mahavidyalaya at their recently organised cultural fiesta —Aakar—where everyone enjoyed cultural treats, entertaining acts and fun-filled competitions. The discerning audience enjoyed a fine bouquet of performing arts and shared a good time interacting with one another on this occasion.  “This fest is a melting pot of various art forms and the students have been given a great platform by the college to exhibit their talent. From traditional dance performances to skits, mono acts, painting exhibitions to food stalls, there was a fine mix of everything for people to enjoy,” said lecturer Kishore Ingale.  We spotted principal of the college Vinod Mankar and educationists Subhash Babhulkar, Vikash Joshi, Rakesh Pathrabe and Rajendra Giri having a good time at the fiesta. Farmers\u2019 body gears up for sowing o.description: NAGPUR: Farmers’ organization Shetkari Sangathana has printed declaration forms on which it plans to get signatures of peasants across the state for planting illegal genetically modified variety of herbicide tolerant (HT) seeds in their fields. In what it calls to be a civil disobedience movement of its kind, the Sangathana has been pressing for free access to technology in agriculture including mass use of GM seeds. The HT seeds that have been developed by American biotech giant Monsanto are resistant to herbicides (weed killers), which have glyphosate as a key ingredient. Even the glyphosate-based herbicide has been developed by Monsanto. Shetkari Sangathana has been demanding that the government should allow use of HT seeds, as it will help them save a major cost on removal of weeds by deploying manual labour. However, experts say even if the seeds are allowed, cotton farmers may not be able to use HT variety legally. Former director of Central Institute of Cotton Research (CICR) Keshav Kranthi said that this is because glyphosate-based herbicide are only recommended for use in teal plantations and barren land. Without being allowed to use glyphosate, HT seeds not be of any use to the cotton grower. Kranthi now heads the technical section of International Cotton Advisory Council in the US. In its comment to an earlier report carried by TOI, even Monsanto had said, “In India, glyphosate-based herbicides have been recommended for use in general weed control in non-cropped areas such as tea and pre-plant rice. It should be used only as per the recommended guidelines.” Anil Ghanawat, President of Shetkari Sangathana, however said that glyphosate is non-selective herbicide and can also be used on the cotton crop. Shetkari Sangathana had started its campaign last week from Akoli Jahangir village of Akola district where farmer Lalit Bahale planted the seeds in front of police and 1,200 other farmers. If proven, this can lead to a five-year sentence. After that, farmers in districts like Wardha, Dhule and Ahmednagar have planted the seeds. This would be followed by farmers in Parbhani and Amravati. The declaration form prepared by the Sangathana will have details like farmers’ name, village and the area in which the seed has been planted. Shetkari Sangathana has been pressing that the government should allow use of HT seeds. However, after the trials, Monsanto itself had withdrawn its application in 2016. On this, Ghanawat said it was due to the low royalty it would have got on the seeds. “The Sangathana demands that the government should not intervene in the prices and give the technology provider a free hand letting the market decide the price,” he said. Om Birla.description: NEW DELHI: The BJP's surprise pick — Om Birla — is all set to become the next Lok Sabha Speaker after his candidature on Tuesday was backed by all NDA allies as also by the YSR Congress Party, the Biju Janata Dal and key opposition parties, including the Congress. A notice was given to the Lok Sabha Secretariat by the BJP, proposing the name of Birla, a two-time MP from Kota-Bundi seat in Rajasthan, for the Speaker's post and bringing a motion for his election, which will be held on Wednesday. As per sources, Prime Minister Narendra Modi proposed 57-year-old Birla's name for the post. The Rajasthan leader is considered to be close to both Modi and BJP president Amit Shah. 10 parties extend support to Om Birla's candidature for Lok Sabha speaker: Prahlad JoshiBirla's surprise nomination is seen by many in the BJP as a message from the top leadership that the party will promote leaders who keep a low-profile and work at the ground-level. BJD, YSRCP, JDU, Shiv Sena, Akali Dal, National People's Party, Mizo National Front, Lok Janshakti Party, AIADMK and Apna Dal have given the notice to support Birla's candidature for the Speaker's post, parliamentary affairs minister Pralhad Joshi told reporters. Later, Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said the party and the UPA allies have also decided to support the candidature of Birla as the Speaker. Chowdhury also said the Congress has already moved a motion supporting the ruling party candidate. The decision to support Birla's nomination was taken at a meeting of the UPA allies, where the leaders also discussed the opposition strategy during Parliament session. Birla won his first Lok Sabha election in 2014 and was re-elected from Rajasthan's Kota-Bundi seat. He defeated Congress's Ramnaraian Meena with a margin of over 2.5 lakh votes in the recently concluded general election. He has also been elected to Rajasthan assembly for three consecutive terms in 2003, 2008 and 2013. Birla will succeed eight-term MP Sumitra Mahajan as the Speaker, a post traditionally held by senior MPs. However, this will not be for the first time a relative newcomer will hold the position. In 1996, TDP leader G M C Balayogi was also a two-time MP when he was elected as the LS Speaker and after his death in a helicopter crash in 2002, Shiv Sena leader and the first-time MP Manohar Joshi was appointed to the position. City water crisis set to aggravate as mi.description: NAGPUR: Water crisis in the city as well as for irrigation in the district is likely to increase compared to this year as Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) will be unable to utilize running water of Kanhan river. The huge saving of water in Pench reservoirs will not be possible as the water resources department (WRD) is all set to miss the deadline for completing Kochchhi barrage on Kanhan river by December-end. The NMC standing committee on Tuesday approved the water works department’s proposal to appoint WAPCOS Limited, a central government company, to prepare Detailed Project Report (DPR) and also execute the project to use running water of Kanhan river instead of water from Pench reservoirs for six months, from June to December. The civic body will pay WAPCOS Rs21.99 crore for the project. NMC uses water from Pench reservoirs to supply drinking water to 70% areas of the city throughout the year. Requirement of remaining water is met from running water of Kanhan river. During summer, Kanhan river has to be fed from Pench reservoirs. Huge quantum of water goes waste from Kanhan river between June and December due to lack of a reservoir on it. Therefore, NMC planned to lay a pipeline from Kanhan river and use this running water instead of water from Pench reservoirs in these six months. The plan approved on Tuesday will take at least one year for WAPCOS Limited to prepare DPR and complete the project. The plan was prepared in June last year but was delayed due to reasons known only to NMC officials. Due to shortage of water in Pench reservoirs, WRD could not supply water for irrigation during both, kharip and rabbi, seasons. NMC is drawing water from dead stock of Pench reservoirs for last one month. The Pench reservoirs are likely to get less water this year too due to construction of Chaurai dam by Madhya Pradesh upstream of Pench river. Therefore, the delay in mitigation measures is likely to increase the water crisis next year. Ruling party leader Sandip Joshi admitted the inordinate delay from the water works department in completing the process. “We have decided to award the work to WAPCOS Limited without going for tendering process due to the delay. The project would have been delayed further in case of tendering,” he said. Standing committee chairman Pradip Pohane said he would check about the delay and take appropriate action. In another setback, WRD officials confirmed water cannot be stored in Kochchhi barrage this monsoon. “Some 80% of the works are completed. Project require another Rs300 crore for completion. We will be able to store water only in the next monsoon,” they said. The barrage costing Rs947 crore is the first on Kanhan river. Around 75 million meter cube (MMC) water could have been stored in the barrage if it had been completed in time. The project was delayed due to shortage of funds. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil.
